entry.name: @bottom-center
entry.desc: A variable-width box within the area defined by the bottom margin, centered on the page area, and between the bottom-left and bottom-right margin boxes.

entry.name: @bottom-left
entry.desc: A variable-width box within the area defined by the bottom margin and adjoining the bottom-left-corner margin box.

entry.name: @bottom-left-corner
entry.desc: A box filling the area defined by the intersection of the bottom and left margins of the page box.

entry.name: @bottom-right
entry.desc: A variable-width box within the area defined by the bottom margin and adjoining the bottom-right corner margin box.

entry.name: @bottom-right-corner
entry.desc: A box filling the area defined by the intersection of the bottom and right margins of the page box.

entry.name: @charset
entry.desc: Defines character set of the document.

entry.name: @counter
entry.desc: Authors may use @counter declaration blocks and the 'page-policy' property, which applies only to strings and counters.

entry.name: @counter-style
entry.desc: Defines a custom counter style.

entry.name: @font-face
entry.desc: Allows for linking to fonts that are automatically activated when needed. This permits authors to work around the limitation of 'web-safe' fonts, allowing for consistent rendering independent of the fonts available in a given user's environment.

entry.name: @host
entry.desc: Applies to elements specified in shadow trees.

entry.name: @import
entry.desc: Includes content of another file.

entry.name: @keyframes
entry.desc: Defines set of animation key frames.

entry.name: @left-bottom
entry.desc: A variable-height box within the area defined by the left margin and adjacent to the top of the bottom-left-corner.

entry.name: @left-middle
entry.desc: A variable-height box in the area defined by the left margin, centered on the page area, and between the left-top and left-bottom margin boxes.

entry.name: @left-top
entry.desc: A variable-height box within the area defined by the left margin and adjacent to the bottom of the top-left-corner.

entry.name: @media
entry.desc: Defines a stylesheet for a particular media type.

entry.name: @-moz-document
entry.desc: The @-moz-document rule is a Gecko-specific at-rule that restricts the style rules contained within it based on the URL of the document.

entry.name: @-moz-keyframes
entry.desc: Defines set of animation key frames.

entry.name: @namespace
entry.desc: Declares a prefix and associates it with a namespace name.

entry.name: @-o-viewport
entry.desc: Sets the viewport properties in Opera Mobile 11 - 12.1.

entry.name: @page
entry.desc: Directive defines various page parameters.

entry.name: @right-bottom
entry.desc: A variable-height box within the area defined by the right margin and adjacent to the top of the bottom-right-corner.

entry.name: @right-middle
entry.desc: A variable-height box in the area defined by the right margin, centered on the page area, and between the right-top and right-bottom margin boxes.

entry.name: @right-top
entry.desc: A variable-height box within the area defined by the right margin and adjacent to the bottom of the top-right-corner.

entry.name: @string
entry.desc: Authors may use @string declaration blocks and the 'page-policy' property, which applies only to strings and counters.

entry.name: @supports
entry.desc: A conditional group rule whose condition tests whether the user agent supports CSS property:value pairs.

entry.name: @top-center
entry.desc: A variable-width box within the area defined by the top margin, centered on the page area, and between the top-left and top-right margin boxes.

entry.name: @top-left
entry.desc: A variable-width box within the area defined by the top margin and adjoining the top-left-corner margin box.

entry.name: @top-left-corner
entry.desc: A fixed-size box filling the area defined by the intersection of the top and left margins of the page box.

entry.name: @top-right
entry.desc: A variable-width box within the area defined by the top margin and adjoining the top-right-corner margin box.

entry.name: @top-right-corner
entry.desc: A box filling the area defined by the intersection of the top and right margins of the page box.

entry.name: @viewport
entry.desc: Specifies the size, zoom factor, and orientation of the viewport.

entry.name: @-webkit-keyframes
entry.desc: Defines set of animation key frames.

entry.name: :active
entry.desc: The :active pseudo-class applies while an element is being activated by the user. For example, between the times the user presses the mouse button and releases it.

entry.name: :after
entry.desc: Pseudo-element is used to insert content immediately after the content of an element (or other pseudo-element). The 'content' property is used to specify the content to insert.

entry.name: :before
entry.desc: Pseudo-element is used to insert content immediately before the content of an element (or other pseudo-element). The 'content' property is used to specify the content to insert.

entry.name: :checked
entry.desc: Radio and checkbox elements can be toggled by the user. Some menu items are 'checked' when the user selects them. When such elements are toggled 'on' the :checked pseudo-class applies.

entry.name: :default
entry.desc: The :default selector applies to the one or more UI elements that are the default among a set of similar elements. This selector typically applies to context menu items, buttons, and select lists/menus.

entry.name: :dir(ltr)
entry.desc: The :dir() pseudo-class allows the author to write selectors that represent an element based on its directionality as determined by the document language.

entry.name: :disabled
entry.desc: The :disabled pseudo-class represents user interface elements that are in a disabled state; such elements have a corresponding enabled state.

entry.name: :empty
entry.desc: The :empty pseudo-class represents an element that has no children at all.

entry.name: :enabled
entry.desc: The :enabled pseudo-class represents user interface elements that are in an enabled state; such elements have a corresponding disabled state.

entry.name: :first
entry.desc: When printing double-sided documents, the page boxes on left and right pages may be different. This can be expressed through CSS pseudo-classes defined in the page context.

entry.name: :first-child
entry.desc: Same as :nth-child(1). The :first-child pseudo-class represents an element that is the first child of some other element.

entry.name: :first-letter
entry.desc: The :first-letter pseudo-element represents the first letter of an element, if it is not preceded by any other content (such as images or inline tables) on its line.

entry.name: :first-line
entry.desc: The :first-line pseudo-element describes the contents of the first formatted line of an element.

entry.name: :first-of-type
entry.desc: Same as :nth-of-type(1). The :first-of-type pseudo-class represents an element that is the first sibling of its type in the list of children of its parent element.

entry.name: :focus
entry.desc: The :focus pseudo-class applies while an element has the focus (accepts keyboard or mouse events, or other forms of input).

entry.name: :hover
entry.desc: The :hover pseudo-class applies while the user designates an element with a pointing device, but does not necessarily activate it. For example, a visual user agent could apply this pseudo-class when the cursor (mouse pointer) hovers over a box generated by the element.

entry.name: :indeterminate
entry.desc: The :indeterminate pseudo-class applies to UI elements whose value is in an indeterminate state.

entry.name: :in-range
entry.desc: The in-range and out-of-range pseudo-classes should be used in conjunction with the min and max attributes, whether on a range input, a number field, or any other types that accept those attributes.

entry.name: :invalid
entry.desc: An element is :valid or :invalid when it is, respectively, valid or invalid with respect to data validity semantics defined by a different specification.

entry.name: :lang(en)
entry.desc: The pseudo-class :lang(C) represents an element that is in language C.

entry.name: :last-child
entry.desc: Same as :nth-last-child(1). The :last-child pseudo-class represents an element that is the last child of some other element.

entry.name: :last-of-type
entry.desc: Same as :nth-last-of-type(1). The :last-of-type pseudo-class represents an element that is the last sibling of its type in the list of children of its parent element.

entry.name: :left
entry.desc: When printing double-sided documents, the page boxes on left and right pages may be different. This can be expressed through CSS pseudo-classes defined in the page context.

entry.name: :link
entry.desc: The :link pseudo-class applies to links that have not yet been visited.

entry.name: :matches(:hover)
entry.desc: A functional notation taking a selector list as its argument. It represents an element that is represented by its argument.

entry.name: :-ms-lang(en)
entry.desc: The pseudo-class :-ms-lang(C) represents an element that is in language C.

entry.name: :not(:empty)
entry.desc: The negation pseudo-class, :not(X), is a functional notation taking a simple selector (excluding the negation pseudo-class itself) as an argument. It represents an element that is not represented by its argument.

entry.name: :nth-child(2n+1)
entry.desc: The :nth-child(an+b) pseudo-class notation represents an element that has an+b-1 siblings before it in the document tree, for any positive integer or zero value of n, and has a parent element.

entry.name: :nth-last-child(-n+2)
entry.desc: The :nth-last-child(an+b) pseudo-class notation represents an element that has an+b-1 siblings after it in the document tree, for any positive integer or zero value of n, and has a parent element.

entry.name: :nth-last-match(div)
entry.desc: Represents an element that has An+B-1 siblings that match the given selector list after it in the document tree.

entry.name: :nth-last-of-type(n+2)
entry.desc: The :nth-last-of-type(an+b) pseudo-class notation represents an element that has an+b-1 siblings with the same expanded element name after it in the document tree, for any zero or positive integer value of n, and has a parent element.

entry.name: :nth-match(div)
entry.desc: Represents an element that has An+B-1 siblings that match the given selector list before it in the document tree.

entry.name: :nth-of-type(2n+1)
entry.desc: The :nth-of-type(an+b) pseudo-class notation represents an element that has an+b-1 siblings with the same expanded element name before it in the document tree, for any zero or positive integer value of n, and has a parent element.

entry.name: :only-child
entry.desc: Represents an element that has a parent element and whose parent element has no other element children. Same as :first-child:last-child or :nth-child(1):nth-last-child(1), but with a lower specificity.

entry.name: :only-of-type
entry.desc: The :only-of-type selector matches every element that is the only child of its type, of its parent. Same as :first-of-type:last-of-type or :nth-of-type(1):nth-last-of-type(1), but with a lower specificity.

entry.name: :optional
entry.desc: A form element is :required or :optional if a value for it is, respectively, required or optional before the form it belongs to is submitted. Elements that are not form elements are neither required nor optional.

entry.name: :out-of-range
entry.desc: The in-range and out-of-range pseudo-classes should be used in conjunction with the min and max attributes, whether on a range input, a number field, or any other types that accept those attributes.

entry.name: :read-only
entry.desc: An element whose contents are not user-alterable is :read-only. However, elements whose contents are user-alterable (such as text input fields) are considered to be in a :read-write state. In typical documents, most elements are :read-only.

entry.name: :read-write
entry.desc: An element whose contents are not user-alterable is :read-only. However, elements whose contents are user-alterable (such as text input fields) are considered to be in a :read-write state. In typical documents, most elements are :read-only.

entry.name: :required
entry.desc: A form element is :required or :optional if a value for it is, respectively, required or optional before the form it belongs to is submitted. Elements that are not form elements are neither required nor optional.

entry.name: :right
entry.desc: When printing double-sided documents, the page boxes on left and right pages may be different. This can be expressed through CSS pseudo-classes defined in the page context.

entry.name: :root
entry.desc: The :root pseudo-class represents an element that is the root of the document. In HTML 4, this is always the HTML element.

entry.name: :scope
entry.desc: The :scope pseudo-class represents any element that is in the contextual reference element set.

entry.name: :target
entry.desc: Some URIs refer to a location within a resource. This kind of URI ends with a 'number sign' (#) followed by an anchor identifier (called the fragment identifier).

entry.name: :valid
entry.desc: An element is :valid or :invalid when it is, respectively, valid or invalid with respect to data validity semantics defined by a different specification.

entry.name: :visited
entry.desc: The :visited pseudo-class applies once the link has been visited by the user.

entry.name: ::after
entry.desc: Pseudo-element is used to insert content immediately after the content of an element (or other pseudo-element). The 'content' property is used to specify the content to insert.

entry.name: ::after(2)
entry.desc: Pseudo-element is used to insert content immediately after the content of an element (or other pseudo-element). The number parameter is used when multiple '::after()' functions are used in conjunction. The 'content' property is used to specify the content to insert.

entry.name: ::alternate
entry.desc: This pseudo-element is created by setting its 'move-to' property to an identifier. It is rendered at the next occurrence of 'pending()' in a 'content' property.

entry.name: ::before
entry.desc: Pseudo-element is used to insert content immediately before the content of an element (or other pseudo-element). The 'content' property is used to specify the content to insert.

entry.name: ::before(2)
entry.desc: Pseudo-element is used to insert content immediately before the content of an element (or other pseudo-element). The number parameter is used when multiple '::before()' functions are used in conjunction. The 'content' property is used to specify the content to insert.

entry.name: ::first-letter
entry.desc: The ::first-letter pseudo-element represents the first letter of an element, if it is not preceded by any other content (such as images or inline tables) on its line.

entry.name: ::first-line
entry.desc: The ::first-line pseudo-element describes the contents of the first formatted line of an element.

entry.name: ::line-marker
entry.desc: The '::line-marker' pseudo-element is positioned in exactly the same way as the '::marker' pseudo-element, but appears on every line, not just the first.

entry.name: ::marker
entry.desc: For a '::marker' pseudo-element to be generated, its superior parent must have a computed 'display' value of 'list-item'.

entry.name: ::-ms-browse
entry.desc: Applies one or more styles to the browse button of an input type=file control.

entry.name: ::-ms-check
entry.desc: Applies one or more styles to the check of a checkbox or radio button input control.

entry.name: ::-ms-clear
entry.desc: Applies one or more styles to the entry area of a text input control when it contains no content.

entry.name: ::-ms-expand
entry.desc: Applies one or more styles to the drop-down button of a select control.

entry.name: ::-ms-fill
entry.desc: Applies one or more styles to the bar portion of a progress bar.

entry.name: ::-ms-fill-lower
entry.desc: Applies one or more styles to portion of the slider track from its smallest value up to the value currently selected by the thumb. In a left-to-right layout, this is the portion of the slider track to the left of the thumb.

entry.name: ::-ms-fill-upper
entry.desc: Applies one or more styles to portion of the slider track from the value currently selected by the thumb up to the slider's largest value. In a left-to-right layout, this is the portion of the slider track to the right of the thumb.

entry.name: ::-ms-reveal
entry.desc: Applies one or more styles to the password reveal button of an input type=password control.

entry.name: ::-ms-thumb
entry.desc: Applies one or more styles to portion of the range input control (also known as a slider control) that the user drags.

entry.name: ::-ms-ticks-after
entry.desc: Applies one or more styles to the tick marks of a slider that begin just after the thumb and continue up to the slider's largest value. In a left-to-right layout, these are the ticks to the right of the thumb.

entry.name: ::-ms-ticks-before
entry.desc: Applies one or more styles to the tick marks of a slider that represent its smallest values up to the value currently selected by the thumb. In a left-to-right layout, these are the ticks to the left of the thumb.

entry.name: ::-ms-tooltip
entry.desc: Applies one or more styles to the tooltip of a slider (input type=range).

entry.name: ::-ms-track
entry.desc: Applies one or more styles to track of a slider.

entry.name: ::-ms-value
entry.desc: Applies one or more styles to the content of a text or password input control, or a select control.

entry.name: ::outside
entry.desc: An '::outside' pseudo-element is one that is generated immediately outside the pseudo-element's superior.

entry.name: ::outside(2)
entry.desc: An '::outside' pseudo-element is one that is generated immediately outside the pseudo-element's superior. When given a parameter, '::outside(n)' represents an nth pseudo-element generated immediately around the n-1th pseudo-element.

entry.name: ::selection
entry.desc: The ::selection selector matches the portion of an element that is selected by a user. Only a few CSS properties can be applied to ::selection: color, background, cursor, and outline.

entry.name: align-content
entry.desc: Aligns a flex container's lines within the flex container when there is extra space in the cross-axis, similar to how 'justify-content' aligns individual items within the main-axis.

entry.name: align-items
entry.desc: Flex items can be aligned in the cross axis of the current line of the flex container, similar to 'justify-content' but in the perpendicular direction.

entry.name: align-self
entry.desc: Flex items can be aligned in the cross axis of the current line of the flex container, similar to 'justify-content' but in the perpendicular direction.

entry.name: animation
entry.desc: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.

value.name: alternate
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

value.name: alternate-reverse
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

value.name: backwards
value.desc: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

value.name: both
value.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

value.name: cubic-bezier()
value.desc: Specifies a cubic-bezier curve. The four values specify points P1 and P2 of the curve as (x1, y1, x2, y2). All values must be in the range [0, 1].

value.name: ease
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.25, 0.1, 0.25, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in-out
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: ease-out
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: forwards
value.desc: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

value.name: infinite
value.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

value.name: linear
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: none
value.desc: No animation is performed

value.name: normal
value.desc: Normal playback.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

value.name: step-end
value.desc: The step-end function is equivalent to steps(1, end).

value.name: steps(1, start)
value.desc: The first parameter specifies the number of intervals in the function. The second parameter, which is optional, is either the value 'start' or 'end'.

value.name: step-start
value.desc: The step-start function is equivalent to steps(1, start).

entry.name: animation-delay
entry.desc: Defines when the animation will start. An 'animation-delay' value of '0' means the animation will execute as soon as it is applied. Otherwise, the value specifies an offset from the moment the animation is applied, and the animation will delay execution by that offset.

entry.name: animation-direction
entry.desc: Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.

value.name: alternate
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

value.name: alternate-reverse
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Normal playback.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

entry.name: animation-duration
entry.desc: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.

entry.name: animation-fill-mode
entry.desc: Defines what values are applied by the animation outside the time it is executing.

value.name: backwards
value.desc: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

value.name: both
value.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

value.name: forwards
value.desc: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

value.name: none
value.desc: There is no change to the property value between the time the animation is applied and the time the animation begins playing or after the animation completes.

entry.name: animation-iteration-count
entry.desc: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.

value.name: infinite
value.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

entry.name: animation-name
entry.desc: Defines a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.

value.name: none
value.desc: No animation is performed

entry.name: animation-play-state
entry.desc: Defines whether the animation is running or paused.

value.name: paused
value.desc: A running animation will be paused.

value.name: running
value.desc: Resume playback of a paused animation.

entry.name: animation-timing-function
entry.desc: Describes how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration. See the 'transition-timing-function'.

value.name: cubic-bezier()
value.desc: Specifies a cubic-bezier curve. The four values specify points P1 and P2 of the curve as (x1, y1, x2, y2). All values must be in the range [0, 1].

value.name: ease
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.25, 0.1, 0.25, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in-out
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: ease-out
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: linear
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: step-end
value.desc: The step-end function is equivalent to steps(1, end).

value.name: steps(1, start)
value.desc: The first parameter specifies the number of intervals in the function. The second parameter, which is optional, is either the value 'start' or 'end'.

value.name: step-start
value.desc: The step-start function is equivalent to steps(1, start).

entry.name: azimuth
entry.syntax: <angle> | [[ left-side | far-left | left | center-left | center | center-right | right | far-right | right-side ] || behind ] | leftwards | rightwards
entry.desc: Sound spatial information

value.name: center
value.desc: Same as '0deg'. With 'behind', '180deg'.

value.name: center-left
value.desc: Same as '340deg'. With 'behind', '200deg'.

value.name: center-right
value.desc: Same as '20deg'. With 'behind', '160deg'.

value.name: far-left
value.desc: Same as '300deg'. With 'behind', '240deg'.

value.name: far-right
value.desc: Same as '60deg'. With 'behind', '120deg'.

value.name: left
value.desc: Same as '320deg'. With 'behind', '220deg'

value.name: left-side
value.desc: Same as '270deg'. With 'behind', '270deg'.

value.name: leftwards
value.desc: Moves the sound to the left, relative to the current angle. More precisely, subtracts 20 degrees.

value.name: right
value.desc: Same as '40deg'. With 'behind', '140deg'.

value.name: right-side
value.desc: Same as '90deg'. With 'behind', '90deg'.

value.name: rightwards
value.desc: Moves the sound to the right, relative to the current angle. More precisely, adds 20 degrees.

entry.name: backface-visibility
entry.desc: Determines whether or not the 'back' side of a transformed element is visible when facing the viewer. With an identity transform, the front side of an element faces the viewer.

entry.name: background
entry.desc: Background of an element

value.name: border-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the border box.

value.name: bottom
value.desc: Equivalent to '100%' for the vertical position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the bottom edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: center
value.desc: Equivalent to '50%' ('left 50%') for the horizontal position if the horizontal position is not otherwise specified, or '50%' ('top 50%') for the vertical position if it is.

value.name: content-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the content box.

value.name: fixed
value.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the viewport. In paged media where there is no viewport, a 'fixed' background is fixed with respect to the page box and therefore replicated on every page.

value.name: left
value.desc: Equivalent to '0%' for the horizontal position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the left edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: local
value.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the element's contents: if the element has a scrolling mechanism, the background scrolls with the element's contents.

value.name: none
value.desc: A value of 'none' counts as an image layer but draws nothing.

value.name: no-repeat
value.desc: The image is placed once and not repeated in this direction.

value.name: padding-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the padding box

value.name: repeat
value.desc: The image is repeated in this direction as often as needed to cover the background painting area.

value.name: repeat-x
value.desc: Equivalent to 'repeat no-repeat'.

value.name: repeat-y
value.desc: Equivalent to 'no-repeat repeat'.

value.name: right
value.desc: Equivalent to '100%' for the horizontal position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the right edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: round
value.desc: The image is repeated as often as will fit within the background positioning area. If it doesn't fit a whole number of times, it is rescaled so that it does.

value.name: scroll
value.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the element itself and does not scroll with its contents. (It is effectively attached to the element's border.)

value.name: space
value.desc: The image is repeated as often as will fit within the background positioning area without being clipped and then the images are spaced out to fill the area. The first and last images touch the edges of the area.

value.name: top
value.desc: Equivalent to '0%' for the vertical position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the top edge as the origin for the next offset.

entry.name: background-attachment
entry.desc: If background images are specified, this property specifies whether they are fixed with regard to the viewport ('fixed') or scroll along with the element ('scroll') or its contents ('local').

value.name: fixed
value.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the viewport. In paged media where there is no viewport, a 'fixed' background is fixed with respect to the page box and therefore replicated on every page.

value.name: local
value.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the element's contents: if the element has a scrolling mechanism, the background scrolls with the element's contents.

value.name: scroll
value.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the element itself and does not scroll with its contents. (It is effectively attached to the element's border.)

entry.name: background-clip
entry.desc: Determines the background painting area.

value.name: border-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the border box.

value.name: content-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the content box.

value.name: padding-box

entry.name: background-image
entry.desc: Image used for an element's background

value.name: none
value.desc: A value of 'none' counts as an image layer but draws nothing.

entry.name: background-origin
entry.desc: For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the background positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes 'box-decoration-break' operates on to determine the background positioning area(s).

value.name: border-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the border box.

value.name: content-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the content box.

value.name: padding-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the padding box

entry.name: background-position
entry.desc: If background images have been specified, this property specifies their initial position (after any resizing) within their corresponding background positioning area.

value.name: bottom
value.desc: Equivalent to '100%' for the vertical position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the bottom edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: center
value.desc: Equivalent to '50%' ('left 50%') for the horizontal position if the horizontal position is not otherwise specified, or '50%' ('top 50%') for the vertical position if it is.

value.name: left
value.desc: Equivalent to '0%' for the horizontal position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the left edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: right
value.desc: Equivalent to '100%' for the horizontal position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the right edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: top
value.desc: Equivalent to '0%' for the vertical position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the top edge as the origin for the next offset.

entry.name: background-position-x
entry.desc: If background images have been specified, this property specifies their initial position (after any resizing) within their corresponding background positioning area.

value.name: bottom
value.desc: Equivalent to '100%' for the vertical position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the bottom edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: center
value.desc: Equivalent to '50%' ('left 50%') for the horizontal position if the horizontal position is not otherwise specified, or '50%' ('top 50%') for the vertical position if it is.

value.name: left
value.desc: Equivalent to '0%' for the horizontal position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the left edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: right
value.desc: Equivalent to '100%' for the horizontal position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the right edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: top
value.desc: Equivalent to '0%' for the vertical position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the top edge as the origin for the next offset.

entry.name: background-position-y
entry.desc: If background images have been specified, this property specifies their initial position (after any resizing) within their corresponding background positioning area.

value.name: bottom
value.desc: Equivalent to '100%' for the vertical position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the bottom edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: center
value.desc: Equivalent to '50%' ('left 50%') for the horizontal position if the horizontal position is not otherwise specified, or '50%' ('top 50%') for the vertical position if it is.

value.name: left
value.desc: Equivalent to '0%' for the horizontal position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the left edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: right
value.desc: Equivalent to '100%' for the horizontal position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the right edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: top
value.desc: Equivalent to '0%' for the vertical position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the top edge as the origin for the next offset.

entry.name: background-repeat
entry.desc: How the background image is tiled within an element

value.name: no-repeat
value.desc: The image is placed once and not repeated in this direction.

value.name: repeat
value.desc: The image is repeated in this direction as often as needed to cover the background painting area.

value.name: repeat-x
value.desc: Equivalent to 'repeat no-repeat'.

value.name: repeat-y
value.desc: Equivalent to 'no-repeat repeat'.

value.name: round
value.desc: The image is repeated as often as will fit within the background positioning area. If it doesn't fit a whole number of times, it is rescaled so that it does.

value.name: space
value.desc: The image is repeated as often as will fit within the background positioning area without being clipped and then the images are spaced out to fill the area. The first and last images touch the edges of the area.

entry.name: background-size
entry.desc: Specifies the size of the background images.

value.name: contain
value.desc: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the largest size such that both its width and its height can fit inside the background positioning area.

value.name: cover
value.desc: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the smallest size such that both its width and its height can completely cover the background positioning area.

entry.name: behavior
entry.desc: IE only. Used to extend behaviors of the browser

entry.name: border
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting border width, style and color

value.name: dashed
value.desc: A series of square-ended dashes.

value.name: dotted
value.desc: A series of round dots.

value.name: double
value.desc: Two parallel solid lines with some space between them. (The thickness of the lines is not specified, but the sum of the lines and the space must equal 'border-width'.)

value.name: groove
value.desc: Looks as if it were carved in the canvas. (This is typically achieved by creating a "shadow" from two colors that are slightly lighter and darker than the 'border-color'.)

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Same as 'none', but has different behavior in the border conflict resolution rules for border-collapsed tables.

value.name: inset
value.desc: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is sunken into the canvas. Treated as 'ridge' in border-collapsed tables.

value.name: none
value.desc: No border. Color and width are ignored (i.e., the border has width 0, unless the border is an image)

value.name: outset
value.desc: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is coming out of the canvas. Treated as 'groove' in border-collapsed tables.

value.name: ridge
value.desc: Looks as if it were coming out of the canvas.

value.name: solid
value.desc: A single line segment.

entry.name: border-bottom-left-radius
entry.desc: The two length or percentage values of the 'border-*-radius' properties define the radii of a quarter ellipse that defines the shape of the corner of the outer border edge. The first value is the horizontal radius, the second the vertical radius. If the second value is omitted it is copied from the first. If either length is zero, the corner is square, not rounded. Percentages for the horizontal radius refer to the width of the border box, whereas percentages for the vertical radius refer to the height of the border box.

entry.name: border-bottom-right-radius
entry.desc: The two length or percentage values of the 'border-*-radius' properties define the radii of a quarter ellipse that defines the shape of the corner of the outer border edge. The first value is the horizontal radius, the second the vertical radius. If the second value is omitted it is copied from the first. If either length is zero, the corner is square, not rounded. Percentages for the horizontal radius refer to the width of the border box, whereas percentages for the vertical radius refer to the height of the border box.

value.name: dashed

value.name: outset

entry.name: border-bottom-width
entry.desc: 'Border-width' is a shorthand that sets the four 'border-*-width' properties. If it has four values, they set top, right, bottom and left in that order. If left is missing, it is the same as right; if bottom is missing, it is the same as top; if right is missing, it is the same as top.

value.name: separate

entry.name: border-image
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

value.name: auto
value.desc: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved. (By default it is discarded, i.e., treated as empty.)

value.name: repeat
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

value.name: round
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

value.name: space
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: The image is stretched to fill the area.

entry.name: border-image-outset
entry.desc: The values specify the amount by which the border image area extends beyond the border box on the top, right, bottom, and left sides respectively. If the fourth value is absent, it is the same as the second. If the third one is also absent, it is the same as the first. If the second one is also absent, it is the same as the first. Numbers represent multiples of the corresponding border-width.

entry.name: border-image-repeat
entry.desc: Specifies how the images for the sides and the middle part of the border image are scaled and tiled. If the second keyword is absent, it is assumed to be the same as the first.

value.name: repeat
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

value.name: round
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

value.name: space
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: The image is stretched to fill the area.

entry.name: border-image-slice
entry.desc: The four 'border-image-slice' values represent inward offsets from the top, right, bottom, and left edges of the image respectively, dividing it into nine regions: four corners, four edges and a middle. The middle image part is discarded (treated as fully transparent) unless the 'fill' keyword is present. (It is drawn over the background; see the border-image drawing process.) If the fourth number/percentage is absent, it is the same as the second. If the third one is also absent, it is the same as the first. If the second one is also absent, it is the same as the first.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved. (By default it is discarded, i.e., treated as empty.)

entry.name: border-image-source
entry.desc: Specifies an image to use instead of the border styles given by the 'border-style' properties and as an additional background layer for the element. If the value is 'none' or if the image cannot be displayed, the border styles will be used.

entry.name: border-image-width
entry.desc: The four values of 'border-image-width' specify offsets that are used to divide the border image area into nine parts. They represent inward distances from the top, right, bottom, and left sides of the area, respectively.

value.name: auto
value.desc: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

value.name: dashed
value.desc: A series of square-ended dashes.

value.name: dotted

value.desc: Two parallel solid lines with some space between them. (The thickness of the lines is not specified, but the sum of the lines and the space must equal 'border-width'.)

value.name: groove
value.desc: Looks as if it were carved in the canvas. (This is typically achieved by creating a "shadow" from two colors that are slightly lighter and darker than the 'border-color'.)

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Same as 'none', but has different behavior in the border conflict resolution rules for border-collapsed tables.

value.name: inset
value.desc: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is sunken into the canvas. Treated as 'ridge' in border-collapsed tables.

value.name: none

entry.name: border-left-width
entry.desc: 'Border-width' is a shorthand that sets the four 'border-*-width' properties. If it has four values, they set top, right, bottom and left in that order. If left is missing, it is the same as right; if bottom is missing, it is the same as top; if right is missing, it is the same as top.

entry.name: border-radius
entry.desc: The two length or percentage values of the 'border-*-radius' properties define the radii of a quarter ellipse that defines the shape of the corner of the outer border edge. The first value is the horizontal radius, the second the vertical radius. If the second value is omitted it is copied from the first. If either length is zero, the corner is square, not rounded. Percentages for the horizontal radius refer to the width of the border box, whereas percentages for the vertical radius refer to the height of the border box.

entry.name: border-spacing
entry.desc: The lengths specify the distance that separates adjoining cell borders. If one length is specified, it gives both the horizontal and vertical spacing. If two are specified, the first gives the horizontal spacing and the second the vertical spacing. Lengths may not be negative.

entry.name: border-width
entry.desc: 'Border-width' is a shorthand that sets the four 'border-*-width' properties. If it has four values, they set top, right, bottom and left in that order. If left is missing, it is the same as right; if bottom is missing, it is the same as top; if right is missing, it is the same as top.

entry.name: bottom
entry.desc: Specifies how far an absolutely positioned box's bottom margin edge is offset above the bottom edge of the box's 'containing block'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well

entry.name: box-decoration-break
entry.desc: Specifies whether individual boxes are treated as broken pieces of one continuous box, or whether each box is individually wrapped with the border and padding.

value.name: clone
value.desc: Each box is independently wrapped with the border and padding. The 'border-radius' and 'border-image' and 'box-shadow', if any, are applied to each box independently. The background is drawn independently in each box of the element. A no-repeat background image will thus be rendered once in each box of the element.

value.name: slice
value.desc: No border and no padding are inserted at the break. No box-shadow is drawn at the broken edge; 'border-radius' has no effect at its corners; and the 'border-image' is rendered for the whole box as if it were unbroken. The effect is as though the element were rendered with no break present, and then sliced by the break afterward.

entry.name: box-shadow
entry.desc: Attaches one or more drop-shadows to the box. The property is a comma-separated list of shadows, each specified by 2-4 length values, an optional color, and an optional 'inset' keyword. Omitted lengths are 0; omitted colors are a user agent chosen color.

value.name: inset
value.desc: Changes the drop shadow from an outer shadow (one that shadows the box onto the canvas, as if it were lifted above the canvas) to an inner shadow (one that shadows the canvas onto the box, as if the box were cut out of the canvas and shifted behind it).

entry.name: box-sizing
entry.desc: Box Model addition in CSS3.

value.name: border-box
value.desc: The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) on this element determine the border box of the element.

value.name: content-box
value.desc: Behavior of width and height as specified by CSS2.1. The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) apply to the width and height respectively of the content box of the element.

value.name: padding-box
value.desc: The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) on this element determine the padding box of the element.

entry.name: break-after
entry.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior before the generated box.

value.name: always
value.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid-column
value.desc: Avoid a column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid-page
value.desc: Avoid a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: column
value.desc: Always force a column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: left
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

value.name: page
value.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: right
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

entry.name: break-before
entry.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior before the generated box.

value.name: always
value.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid-column
value.desc: Avoid a column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid-page
value.desc: Avoid a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: column
value.desc: Always force a column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: left
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

value.name: page
value.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: right
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

entry.name: break-inside
entry.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior inside the generated box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break inside the generated box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a page/column break inside the generated box.

value.name: avoid-column
value.desc: Avoid a column break inside the generated box.

value.name: avoid-page
value.desc: Avoid a page break inside the generated box.

entry.name: caption-side
entry.desc: Specifies the position of the caption box with respect to the table box.

value.name: bottom
value.desc: Positions the caption box below the table box.

value.name: top
value.desc: Positions the caption box above the table box.

entry.name: clear
entry.desc: Indicates which sides of an element's box(es) may not be adjacent to an earlier floating box. The 'clear' property does not consider floats inside the element itself or in other block formatting contexts.

value.name: both
value.desc: The clearance of the generated box is set to the amount necessary to place the top border edge below the bottom outer edge of any right-floating and left-floating boxes that resulted from elements earlier in the source document.

value.name: left
value.desc: The clearance of the generated box is set to the amount necessary to place the top border edge below the bottom outer edge of any left-floating boxes that resulted from elements earlier in the source document.

value.name: none
value.desc: No constraint on the box's position with respect to floats.

value.name: right
value.desc: The clearance of the generated box is set to the amount necessary to place the top border edge below the bottom outer edge of any right-floating boxes that resulted from elements earlier in the source document.

entry.name: clip
entry.desc: Defines the visible portion of an element's box.

entry.name: clip-path
entry.desc: Allows authors to control under what circumstances (if any) a particular graphic element can become the target of mouse events.

entry.name: clip-rule
entry.desc: Allows authors to control under what circumstances (if any) a particular graphic element can become the target of mouse events.

value.name: evenodd
value.desc: This rule determines the 'insideness' of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments from the given shape that the ray crosses.

value.name: nonzero
value.desc: This rule determines the 'insideness' of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray.
