entry.name: color-interpolation
entry.desc: Specifies the color space for gradient interpolations, color animations and alpha compositing.

entry.name: color-interpolation-filters
entry.desc: Specifies the color space for imaging operations performed via filter effects.

entry.name: color-rendering
entry.desc: The creator of SVG content might want to provide a hint to the implementation about how to make speed vs. quality tradeoffs as it performs color interpolation and compositing. The color-rendering property provides a hint to the SVG user agent about how to optimize its color interpolation and compositing operations.

entry.name: column-count
entry.desc: Describes the optimal number of columns into which the content of the element will be flowed.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Determines the number of columns by the 'column-width' property and the element width.

entry.name: column-fill
entry.desc: In continuous media, this property will only be consulted if the length of columns has been constrained. Otherwise, columns will automatically be balanced.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Fills columns sequentially.

value.name: balance
value.desc: Balance content equally between columns, if possible.

entry.name: column-gap
entry.desc: Sets the gap between columns. If there is a column rule between columns, it will appear in the middle of the gap.

value.name: normal
value.desc: User agent specific and typically equivalent to 1em.

entry.name: column-rule
entry.desc: This property is a shorthand for setting 'column-rule-width', 'column-rule-style', and 'column-rule-color' at the same place in the style sheet. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

value.name: dashed
value.desc: A series of square-ended dashes.

value.name: dotted
value.desc: A series of round dots.

value.name: double
value.desc: Two parallel solid lines with some space between them. (The thickness of the lines is not specified, but the sum of the lines and the space must equal 'border-width'.)

value.name: groove
value.desc: Looks as if it were carved in the canvas. (This is typically achieved by creating a "shadow" from two colors that are slightly lighter and darker than the 'border-color'.)

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Same as 'none', but has different behavior in the border conflict resolution rules for border-collapsed tables.

value.name: inset
value.desc: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is sunken into the canvas. Treated as 'ridge' in border-collapsed tables.

value.name: none
value.desc: No border. Color and width are ignored (i.e., the border has width 0, unless the border is an image)

value.name: outset
value.desc: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is coming out of the canvas. Treated as 'groove' in border-collapsed tables.

value.name: ridge
value.desc: Looks as if it were coming out of the canvas.

value.name: solid
value.desc: A single line segment.

entry.name: column-rule-color
entry.desc: Sets the color of the column rule

value.name: ActiveBorder
value.desc: Active window border.

value.name: ActiveCaption
value.desc: Active window caption.

value.name: AppWorkspace
value.desc: Background color of multiple document interface.

value.name: Background
value.desc: Desktop background.

value.name: ButtonFace
value.desc: The face background color for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonHighlight
value.desc: The color of the border facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonShadow
value.desc: The color of the border away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonText
value.desc: Text on push buttons.

value.name: CaptionText
value.desc: Text in caption, size box, and scrollbar arrow box.

value.name: currentColor
value.desc: The value of the 'color' property. The computed value of the 'currentColor' keyword is the computed value of the 'color' property. If the 'currentColor' keyword is set on the 'color' property itself, it is treated as 'color:inherit' at parse time.

value.name: flavor
value.desc: The accent color (typically chosen by the user) to customize the user interface of the user agent itself.

value.name: GrayText
value.desc: Grayed (disabled) text. This color is set to #000 if the current display driver does not support a solid gray color.

value.name: Highlight
value.desc: Item(s) selected in a control.

value.name: HighlightText
value.desc: Text of item(s) selected in a control.

value.name: InactiveBorder
value.desc: Inactive window border.

value.name: InactiveCaption
value.desc: Inactive window caption.

value.name: InactiveCaptionText
value.desc: Color of text in an inactive caption.

value.name: InfoBackground
value.desc: Background color for tooltip controls.

value.name: InfoText
value.desc: Text color for tooltip controls.

value.name: Menu
value.desc: Menu background.

value.name: MenuText
value.desc: Text in menus.

value.name: Scrollbar
value.desc: Scroll bar gray area.

value.name: ThreeDDarkShadow
value.desc: The color of the darker (generally outer) of the two borders away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDFace
value.desc: The face background color for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDHighlight
value.desc: The color of the lighter (generally outer) of the two borders facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDLightShadow
value.desc: The color of the darker (generally inner) of the two borders facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDShadow
value.desc: The color of the lighter (generally inner) of the two borders away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: transparent
value.desc: Fully transparent. This keyword can be considered a shorthand for rgba(0,0,0,0) which is its computed value.

value.name: Window
value.desc: Window background.

value.name: WindowFrame
value.desc: Window frame.

value.name: WindowText
value.desc: Text in windows.

entry.name: column-rule-style
entry.desc: Sets the style of the rule between columns of an element.

value.name: dashed
value.desc: A series of square-ended dashes.

value.name: dotted
value.desc: A series of round dots.

value.name: double
value.desc: Two parallel solid lines with some space between them. (The thickness of the lines is not specified, but the sum of the lines and the space must equal 'border-width'.)

value.name: groove
value.desc: Looks as if it were carved in the canvas. (This is typically achieved by creating a "shadow" from two colors that are slightly lighter and darker than the 'border-color'.)

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Same as 'none', but has different behavior in the border conflict resolution rules for border-collapsed tables.

value.name: inset
value.desc: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is sunken into the canvas. Treated as 'ridge' in border-collapsed tables.

value.name: none
value.desc: No border. Color and width are ignored (i.e., the border has width 0, unless the border is an image)

value.name: outset
value.desc: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is coming out of the canvas. Treated as 'groove' in border-collapsed tables.

value.name: ridge
value.desc: Looks as if it were coming out of the canvas.

value.name: solid
value.desc: A single line segment.

entry.name: column-rule-width
entry.desc: Sets the width of the rule between columns. Negative values are not allowed.

entry.name: columns
entry.desc: A shorthand property which sets both 'column-width' and 'column-count'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

entry.name: column-span
entry.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior after the generated box.

value.name: all
value.desc: The element spans across all columns. Content in the normal flow that appears before the element is automatically balanced across all columns before the element appear.

value.name: none
value.desc: The element does not span multiple columns.

entry.name: column-width
entry.desc: This property describes the width of columns in multicol elements.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

entry.name: content
entry.desc: Determines which page-based occurrence of a given element is applied to a counter or string value.

value.name: attr()
value.desc: The attr(n) function returns as a string the value of attribute n for the subject of the selector

value.name: box
value.desc: A hollow square.

value.name: check
value.desc: A check mark.

value.name: circle
value.desc: A hollow circle.

value.name: close-quote
value.desc: Value is replaced by the appropriate string from the 'quotes' property.

value.name: contents
value.desc: Displays the element's descendents.

value.name: counter(name)
value.desc: Counters are denoted by identifiers (see the 'counter-increment' and 'counter-reset' properties).

value.name: counter(name, style)
value.desc: Counters are denoted by identifiers (see the 'counter-increment' and 'counter-reset' properties).

value.name: counters(name, string)
value.desc: Counters are denoted by identifiers (see the 'counter-increment' and 'counter-reset' properties).

value.name: counters(name, string, style)
value.desc: Counters are denoted by identifiers (see the 'counter-increment' and 'counter-reset' properties).

value.name: date(format)
value.desc: Current date and/or time, formatted according to the specified formatting string. Format is based on POSIX date formatting strings.

value.name: diamond
value.desc: A filled diamond. On some platforms, this is similar to 'disc'.

value.name: disc
value.desc: A filled circle.

value.name: endnote
value.desc: Shorthand for 'counter(endnote, normal)'. This is intended to be used on the in-flow part of a endnote.

value.name: footnote
value.desc: Shorthand for 'counter(footnote, normal)'. This is intended to be used on the in-flow part of a footnote.

value.name: hyphen
value.desc: A hyphen bullet.

value.name: icon
value.desc: The (pseudo-)element is replaced in its entirety by the resource referenced by its 'icon' property, and treated as a replaced element.

value.name: inhibit
value.desc: On elements, this inhibits the children of the element from being rendered as children of this element, as if the element was empty. On pseudo-elements, this inhibits the creation of the pseudo-element, as if 'display' computed to 'none'.

value.name: list-item
value.desc: Shorthand for 'counter(list-item, normal)'. Note that this is not equivalent to 'normal' when set on a '::marker' pseudo-element that has a superior with 'display' set to 'list-item', as it ignores the 'list-style' properties.

value.name: no-close-quote
value.desc: Inserts nothing (as in 'none'), but increments (decrements) the level of nesting for quotes.

value.name: none
value.desc: On elements, this inhibits the children of the element from being rendered as children of this element, as if the element was empty. On pseudo-elements it causes the pseudo-element to have no content.

value.name: no-open-quote
value.desc: Inserts nothing (as in 'none'), but increments (decrements) the level of nesting for quotes.

value.name: normal
value.desc: See http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-content/#content for computation rules.

value.name: open-quote
value.desc: Value is replaced by the appropriate string from the 'quotes' property.

value.name: pending()
value.desc: This causes all elements and pseudo-elements whose 'move-to' property computes to the specified identifier to be inserted as children of the current element (or pseudo-element).

value.name: section-note
value.desc: Shorthand for 'counter(section-note, normal)'. This is intended to be used on the in-flow part of a section-note.

value.name: square
value.desc: A filled square.

value.name: string(name)
value.desc: Specifies a string value

entry.name: counter-increment
entry.desc: Counters are used with the 'counter()' and 'counters()' functions of the 'content' property.

value.name: none
value.desc: The counter is not modified.

entry.name: counter-reset
entry.desc: Property accepts one or more names of counters (identifiers), each one optionally followed by an integer. The integer gives the value that the counter is set to on each occurrence of the element.

value.name: none
value.desc: The counter is not modified.

entry.name: crop
entry.desc: Allows a replaced element to be just a rectangular area of an object, instead of the whole object.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The element's computed intrinsic width and height are the same as its actual intrinsic width and height.

value.name: insert-rect(top, right, bottom, left)
value.desc: Each of the four arguments can be a <length> or a <percentage>. All percentage values are computed relative to the intrinsic dimensions of the element, if there is one. Values are offsets relative to the respective edges of the element.

value.name: rect(top, right, bottom, left)
value.desc: Each of the four arguments can be a <length> or a <percentage>. All percentage values are computed relative to the intrinsic dimensions of the element, if there is one. Values are offsets relative to the top left of the element.

entry.name: cue
entry.desc: Shorthand for setting 'cue-before' and 'cue-after'. If two values are given the first value is 'cue-before' and the second is 'cue-after'. If only one value is given, it applies to both properties.

value.name: none
value.desc: No auditory icon is specified.

value.name: silent
value.desc: Value of '0'

value.name: x-loud
value.desc: Value of '100'

entry.name: cue-after
entry.desc: Auditory icons are another way to distinguish semantic elements. Sounds may be played before and/or after the element to delimit it.

value.name: none
value.desc: No auditory icon is specified.

value.name: silent
value.desc: Value of '0'

value.name: x-loud
value.desc: Value of '100'

entry.name: cue-before
entry.desc: Auditory icons are another way to distinguish semantic elements. Sounds may be played before and/or after the element to delimit it.

value.name: none
value.desc: No auditory icon is specified.

value.name: silent
value.desc: Value of '0'

value.name: x-loud
value.desc: Value of '100'

entry.name: cursor
entry.desc: Allows control over cursor appearance in an element

value.name: alias
value.desc: Indicates an alias of/shortcut to something is to be created. Often rendered as an arrow with a small curved arrow next to it.

value.name: all-scroll
value.desc: Indicates that the something can be scrolled in any direction. Often rendered as arrows pointing up, down, left, and right with a dot in the middle.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The UA determines the cursor to display based on the current context.

value.name: cell
value.desc: Indicates that a cell or set of cells may be selected. Often rendered as a thick plus-sign with a dot in the middle.

value.name: col-resize
value.desc: Indicates that the item/column can be resized horizontally. Often rendered as arrows pointing left and right with a vertical bar separating them.

value.name: context-menu
value.desc: A context menu is available for the object under the cursor. Often rendered as an arrow with a small menu-like graphic next to it.

value.name: copy
value.desc: Indicates something is to be copied. Often rendered as an arrow with a small plus sign next to it.

value.name: crosshair
value.desc: A simple crosshair (e.g., short line segments resembling a '+' sign). Often used to indicate a two dimensional bitmap selection mode.

value.name: default
value.desc: The platform-dependent default cursor. Often rendered as an arrow.

value.name: e-resize
value.desc: Indicates that east edge is to be moved.

value.name: ew-resize
value.desc: Indicates a bidirectional east-west resize cursor.

value.name: help
value.desc: Help is available for the object under the cursor. Often rendered as a question mark or a balloon.

value.name: move
value.desc: Indicates something is to be moved.

value.name: ne-resize
value.desc: Indicates that movement starts from north-east corner.

value.name: nesw-resize
value.desc: Indicates a bidirectional north-east/south-west cursor.

value.name: no-drop
value.desc: Indicates that the dragged item cannot be dropped at the current cursor location. Often rendered as a hand or pointer with a small circle with a line through it.

value.name: none
value.desc: No cursor is rendered for the element.

value.name: not-allowed
value.desc: Indicates that the requested action will not be carried out. Often rendered as a circle with a line through it.

value.name: n-resize
value.desc: Indicates that north edge is to be moved.

value.name: ns-resize
value.desc: Indicates a bidirectional north-south cursor.

value.name: nw-resize
value.desc: Indicates that movement starts from north-west corner.

value.name: nwse-resize
value.desc: Indicates a bidirectional north-west/south-east cursor.

value.name: pointer
value.desc: The cursor is a pointer that indicates a link.

value.name: progress
value.desc: A progress indicator. The program is performing some processing, but is different from 'wait' in that the user may still interact with the program. Often rendered as a spinning beach ball, or an arrow with a watch or hourglass.

value.name: row-resize
value.desc: Indicates that the item/row can be resized vertically. Often rendered as arrows pointing up and down with a horizontal bar separating them.

value.name: se-resize
value.desc: Indicates that movement starts from south-east corner.

value.name: s-resize
value.desc: Indicates that south edge is to be moved.

value.name: sw-resize
value.desc: Indicates that movement starts from south-west corner.

value.name: text
value.desc: Indicates text that may be selected. Often rendered as a vertical I-beam.

value.name: vertical-text
value.desc: Indicates vertical-text that may be selected. Often rendered as a horizontal I-beam.

value.name: wait
value.desc: Indicates that the program is busy and the user should wait. Often rendered as a watch or hourglass.

value.name: w-resize
value.desc: Indicates that west edge is to be moved.

value.name: zoom-in
value.desc: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) in or out, and often rendered as a magnifying glass with a '+' or '-' in the center of the glass, for 'zoom-in and 'zoom-out' respectively.

value.name: zoom-out
value.desc: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) in or out, and often rendered as a magnifying glass with a '+' or '-' in the center of the glass, for 'zoom-in and 'zoom-out' respectively.

entry.name: direction
entry.desc: Specifies the base directionality of text and elements on a line, and the directionality of embeddings and overrides for the Unicode bidirectional algorithm.

value.name: ltr
value.desc: Left-to-right direction.

value.name: rtl
value.desc: Right-to-left direction.

entry.name: display
entry.desc: This property, in combination with 'float' and 'position', determines the type of box or boxes that are generated for an element.

value.name: block
value.desc: Block boxes.

value.name: compact
value.desc: Either block boxes or a marker box, depending on context. Properties apply to compact boxes based on their final status.

value.name: inline
value.desc: Inline boxes.

value.name: inline-block
value.desc: A block box, which itself is flowed as a single inline box, similar to a replaced element. The inside of an inline-block is formatted as a block box, and the box itself is formatted as an inline box.

value.name: list-item
value.desc: One or more block boxes and one marker box.

value.name: -ms-grid
value.desc: A value of grid causes an element to display as a block-level Grid element

value.name: -ms-inline-grid
value.desc: A value of inline-grid causes an element to display as an inline-level Grid element.

value.name: none
value.desc: This value causes an element to generate no boxes (i.e., the element has no effect on layout). Descendant elements do not generate any boxes either; this behavior cannot be overridden by setting the 'display' property on the descendants.

value.name: run-in
value.desc: Either block or inline boxes, depending on context. Properties apply to run-in boxes based on their final status (inline-level or block-level).

entry.name: elevation
entry.desc: Sound spatial information

value.name: above
value.desc: Same as '90deg'.

value.name: below
value.desc: Same as '-90deg'.

value.name: higher
value.desc: Adds 10 degrees to the current elevation.

value.name: level
value.desc: Same as '0deg'.

value.name: lower
value.desc: Subtracts 10 degrees from the current elevation.

entry.name: empty-cells
entry.desc: In the separated borders model, this property controls the rendering of borders and backgrounds around cells that have no visible content.

value.name: hide
value.desc: No borders or backgrounds are drawn around/behind empty cells.

value.name: show
value.desc: Borders and backgrounds are drawn around/behind empty cells (like normal cells).

entry.name: enable-background
entry.desc: Allocate a shared background image all graphic elements within a container.

value.name: accumulate
value.desc: If the ancestor container element has a property of new, then all graphics elements within the current container are rendered both on the parent's background image and onto the target.

value.name: new
value.desc: Create a new background image canvas. All children of the current container element can access the background, and they will be rendered onto both the parent's background image canvas in addition to the target device.

entry.name: fill
entry.desc: The 'fill' property paints the interior of the given graphical element.

value.name: ActiveBorder
value.desc: Active window border.

value.name: ActiveCaption
value.desc: Active window caption.

value.name: AppWorkspace
value.desc: Background color of multiple document interface.

value.name: Background
value.desc: Desktop background.

value.name: ButtonFace
value.desc: The face background color for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonHighlight
value.desc: The color of the border facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonShadow
value.desc: The color of the border away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonText
value.desc: Text on push buttons.

value.name: CaptionText
value.desc: Text in caption, size box, and scrollbar arrow box.

value.name: currentColor
value.desc: The value of the 'color' property. The computed value of the 'currentColor' keyword is the computed value of the 'color' property. If the 'currentColor' keyword is set on the 'color' property itself, it is treated as 'color:inherit' at parse time.

value.name: flavor
value.desc: The accent color (typically chosen by the user) to customize the user interface of the user agent itself.

value.name: GrayText
value.desc: Grayed (disabled) text. This color is set to #000 if the current display driver does not support a solid gray color.

value.name: Highlight
value.desc: Item(s) selected in a control.

value.name: HighlightText
value.desc: Text of item(s) selected in a control.

value.name: InactiveBorder
value.desc: Inactive window border.

value.name: InactiveCaption
value.desc: Inactive window caption.

value.name: InactiveCaptionText
value.desc: Color of text in an inactive caption.

value.name: InfoBackground
value.desc: Background color for tooltip controls.

value.name: InfoText
value.desc: Text color for tooltip controls.

value.name: Menu
value.desc: Menu background.

value.name: MenuText
value.desc: Text in menus.

value.name: Scrollbar
value.desc: Scroll bar gray area.

value.name: ThreeDDarkShadow
value.desc: The color of the darker (generally outer) of the two borders away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDFace
value.desc: The face background color for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDHighlight
value.desc: The color of the lighter (generally outer) of the two borders facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDLightShadow
value.desc: The color of the darker (generally inner) of the two borders facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDShadow
value.desc: The color of the lighter (generally inner) of the two borders away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: transparent
value.desc: Fully transparent. This keyword can be considered a shorthand for rgba(0,0,0,0) which is its computed value.

value.name: Window
value.desc: Window background.

value.name: WindowFrame
value.desc: Window frame.

value.name: WindowText
value.desc: Text in windows.

entry.name: fill-opacity
entry.desc: 'fill-opacity' specifies the opacity of the painting operation used to paint the interior the current object.

entry.name: fill-rule
entry.desc: The 'fill-rule' property indicates the algorithm which is to be used to determine what parts of the canvas are included inside the shape.

entry.name: filter
entry.desc: IE only. Used to produce visual effects.

entry.name: fit
entry.syntax: Comma-separated list of 'fit' keywords where 'fit' = fill | hidden | meet | slice
entry.desc: Gives a hint for how to scale a replaced element if neither its 'width' nor its 'height' property is 'auto'.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Scale the object's height and width independently so that the content just touches all edges of the containing box.

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Do not scale the object.

value.name: meet
value.desc: Make the object as large as possible with its width <= 'width' and height <= 'height', while preserving its aspect ratio. Position the object as for the 'hidden' value.

value.name: slice
value.desc: Make the object as small as possible with its width >= 'width' and height >= 'height', while preserving its aspect ratio. Position the object as for the 'hidden' value.

entry.name: fit-position
entry.desc: Gives a hint for how to scale a replaced element if neither its 'width' nor its 'height' property is 'auto'.

value.name: bottom
value.desc: Equivalent to '100%' for the vertical position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the bottom edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: center
value.desc: Equivalent to '50%' ('left 50%') for the horizontal position if the horizontal position is not otherwise specified, or '50%' ('top 50%') for the vertical position if it is.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Scale the object's height and width independently so that the content just touches all edges of the containing box.

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Do not scale the object.

value.name: left
value.desc: Equivalent to '0%' for the horizontal position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the left edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: meet
value.desc: Make the object as large as possible with its width <= 'width' and height <= 'height', while preserving its aspect ratio. Position the object as for the 'hidden' value.

value.name: right
value.desc: Equivalent to '100%' for the horizontal position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the right edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: slice
value.desc: Make the object as small as possible with its width >= 'width' and height >= 'height', while preserving its aspect ratio. Position the object as for the 'hidden' value.

value.name: top
value.desc: Equivalent to '0%' for the vertical position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the top edge as the origin for the next offset.

entry.name: flex
entry.desc: Specifies the components of a flexible length: the flex grow factor and flex shrink factor, and the flex basis.

entry.name: flex-basis
entry.desc: The 'flex-basis' property sets the flex basis. Negative lengths are invalid.

entry.name: flex-direction
entry.desc: Specifies how flexbox items are placed in the flexbox.

entry.name: flex-flow
entry.desc: Specifies how flexbox items are placed in the flexbox.

value.name: nowrap
value.desc: The flexbox is single-line. The cross-start direction is equivalent to either the 'start' or 'before' direction of the current writing mode, whichever is in the cross-axis, and the cross-end direction is the opposite direction of cross-start.

value.name: wrap
value.desc: The flexbox is multi-line. The cross-start direction is equivalent to either the 'start' or 'before' direction of the current writing mode, whichever is in the cross-axis, and the cross-end direction is the opposite direction of cross-start.

value.name: wrap-reverse
value.desc: Same as 'wrap', except the cross-start and cross-end directions are swapped.

entry.name: flex-grow
entry.desc: The 'flex-grow' property sets the flex grow factor. Negative numbers are invalid.

entry.name: flex-shrink
entry.desc: The 'flex-shrink' property sets the flex shrink factor. Negative numbers are invalid.

entry.name: flex-wrap
entry.desc: controls whether the flexbox is single-line or multi-line, and the direction of the cross axis, which affects the direction new lines are stacked in and the meaning of the 'flex-align', 'flex-item-align', and 'flex-line-pack' properties.

value.name: nowrap
value.desc: The flexbox is single-line. The cross-start direction is equivalent to either the 'start' or 'before' direction of the current writing mode, whichever is in the cross-axis, and the cross-end direction is the opposite direction of cross-start.

value.name: wrap
value.desc: The flexbox is multi-line. The cross-start direction is equivalent to either the 'start' or 'before' direction of the current writing mode, whichever is in the cross-axis, and the cross-end direction is the opposite direction of cross-start.

value.name: wrap-reverse
value.desc: Same as 'wrap', except the cross-start and cross-end directions are swapped.

entry.name: float
entry.desc: Specifies how a box should be floated. It may be set for any element, but only applies to elements that generate boxes that are not absolutely positioned.

value.name: left
value.desc: The element generates a block box that is floated to the left. Content flows on the right side of the box, starting at the top (subject to the 'clear' property).

value.name: none
value.desc: The box is not floated.

value.name: right
value.desc: Similar to 'left', except the box is floated to the right, and content flows on the left side of the box, starting at the top.

entry.name: flood-color
entry.desc: Indicates what color to use to flood the current filter primitive subregion.

value.name: ActiveBorder
value.desc: Active window border.

value.name: ActiveCaption
value.desc: Active window caption.

value.name: AppWorkspace
value.desc: Background color of multiple document interface.

value.name: Background
value.desc: Desktop background.

value.name: ButtonFace
value.desc: The face background color for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonHighlight
value.desc: The color of the border facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonShadow
value.desc: The color of the border away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonText
value.desc: Text on push buttons.

value.desc: Text in caption, size box, and scrollbar arrow box.

value.name: currentColor
value.desc: The value of the 'color' property. The computed value of the 'currentColor' keyword is the computed value of the 'color' property. If the 'currentColor' keyword is set on the 'color' property itself, it is treated as 'color:inherit' at parse time.

value.name: flavor
value.desc: The accent color (typically chosen by the user) to customize the user interface of the user agent itself.

value.name: GrayText
value.desc: Grayed (disabled) text. This color is set to #000 if the current display driver does not support a solid gray color.

value.name: Highlight
value.desc: Item(s) selected in a control.

value.name: HighlightText
value.desc: Text of item(s) selected in a control.

value.desc: Inactive window border.

value.name: InactiveCaption

value.name: InactiveCaptionText
value.desc: Color of text in an inactive caption.

value.name: InfoBackground
value.desc: Background color for tooltip controls.

value.name: InfoText
value.desc: Text color for tooltip controls.

value.name: Menu
value.desc: Menu background.

value.name: MenuText
value.desc: Text in menus.

value.name: Scrollbar
value.desc: Scroll bar gray area.

value.name: ThreeDDarkShadow
value.desc: The color of the darker (generally outer) of the two borders away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDFace
value.desc: The face background color for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDHighlight
value.desc: The color of the lighter (generally outer) of the two borders facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDLightShadow
value.desc: The color of the darker (generally inner) of the two borders facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDShadow
value.desc: The color of the lighter (generally inner) of the two borders away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: transparent
value.desc: Fully transparent. This keyword can be considered a shorthand for rgba(0,0,0,0) which is its computed value.

value.name: Window
value.desc: Window background.

value.name: WindowFrame
value.desc: Window frame.

value.name: WindowText
value.desc: Text in windows.

entry.name: flood-opacity
entry.desc: Indicates what opacity to use to flood the current filter primitive subregion.

entry.name: flow-from
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that identifies a Connected Frame container in the document that accepts the content flow from the data source.

entry.name: flow-into
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that identifies an iframe container in the document that serves as the Connected Frame data source.

entry.name: font
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting 'font-style', 'font-variant', 'font-weight', 'font-size', 'line-height', and 'font-family', at the same place in the style sheet. The syntax of this property is based on a traditional typographical shorthand notation to set multiple properties related to fonts.

value.desc: Thin
Extra Light (Ultra Light)
Light
Normal
Medium
Semi Bold (Demi Bold)
Bold
Extra Bold (Ultra Bold)
Black (Heavy)

value.name: bold
value.desc: Same as 700

value.name: bolder
value.desc: Specifies the weight of the face bolder than the inherited value.

value.name: caption
value.desc: The font used for captioned controls (e.g., buttons, drop-downs, etc.).

value.name: icon
value.desc: The font used to label icons.

value.name: italic
value.desc: Selects a font that is labeled 'italic', or, if that is not available, one labeled 'oblique'.

value.name: lighter
value.desc: Specifies the weight of the face lighter than the inherited value.

value.name: menu
value.desc: The font used in menus (e.g., dropdown menus and menu lists).

value.name: message-box
value.desc: The font used in dialog boxes.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Specifies a face that is not labeled as a small-caps font.

value.name: oblique
value.desc: Selects a font that is labeled 'oblique'.

value.name: small-caps
value.desc: Specifies a font that is labeled as a small-caps font. If a genuine small-caps font is not available, user agents should simulate a small-caps font.

value.name: small-caption
value.desc: The font used for labeling small controls.

value.name: status-bar
value.desc: The font used in window status bars.

entry.name: font-family
entry.desc: Specifies a prioritized list of font family names or generic family names. A user agent iterates through the list of family names until it matches an available font that contains a glyph for the character to be rendered.

value.name: Cambria, Cochin, Georgia, Times, Times New Roman, serif
'Gill Sans', 'Gill Sans MT', Calibri, 'Trebuchet MS', sans-serif
'Lucida Sans', 'Lucida Sans Regular', 'Lucida Grande', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif
'Trebuchet MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', 'Lucida Sans', Arial, sans-serif

entry.name: font-feature-settings
entry.desc: This property provides low-level control over OpenType font features. It is intended as a way of providing access to font features that are not widely used but are needed for a particular use case.

value.name: normal
value.desc: No change in glyph substitution or positioning occurs.

entry.name: font-kerning
entry.desc: Kerning is the contextual adjustment of inter-glyph spacing. This property controls metric kerning, kerning that utilizes adjustment data contained in the font.

entry.name: font-language-override
entry.desc: The value of 'normal' implies that when rendering with OpenType fonts the language of the document is used to infer the OpenType language system, used to select language specific features when rendering.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Implies that when rendering with OpenType fonts the language of the document is used to infer the OpenType language system, used to select language specific features when rendering.

entry.name: font-size
entry.desc: Indicates the desired height of glyphs from the font. For scalable fonts, the font-size is a scale factor applied to the EM unit of the font. (Note that certain glyphs may bleed outside their EM box.) For non-scalable fonts, the font-size is converted into absolute units and matched against the declared font-size of the font, using the same absolute coordinate space for both of the matched values.

entry.name: font-size-adjust
entry.desc: This property is a way to preserve the readability of text when font fallback occurs. It does this by adjusting the font-size so that the x-height is the same irregardless of the font used.

value.name: none
value.desc: Do not preserve the font's x-height.

entry.name: font-stretch
entry.desc: The font-stretch property is used to expand or contract the horizontal width of the font. The change is relative to the normal width of the font as displayed by the browser.

value.name: narrower
value.desc: Indicates a narrower value relative to the width of the parent element.

value.name: wider
value.desc: Indicates a wider value relative to the width of the parent element.

entry.name: font-style
entry.desc: Allows italic or oblique faces to be selected. Italic forms are generally cursive in nature while oblique faces are typically sloped versions of the regular face.

value.name: italic
value.desc: Selects a font that is labeled 'italic', or, if that is not available, one labeled 'oblique'.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Selects a face that is classified as 'normal'.

value.name: oblique
value.desc: Selects a font that is labeled 'oblique'.

entry.name: font-synthesis
entry.desc: This property controls whether user agents are allowed to synthesize bold or oblique font faces when a font family lacks bold or italic faces.

value.name: none
value.desc: Disallow all synthetic faces.

entry.name: font-variant
entry.desc: Specifies variant representations of the font

value.name: normal
value.desc: Specifies a face that is not labeled as a small-caps font.

value.name: small-caps
value.desc: Specifies a font that is labeled as a small-caps font. If a genuine small-caps font is not available, user agents should simulate a small-caps font.

entry.name: font-variant-alternates
entry.desc: For any given character, fonts can provide a variety of alternate glyphs in addition to the default glyph for that character. This property provides control over the selection of these alternate glyphs.

value.name: annotation()
value.desc: Enables display of alternate annotation forms.

value.name: character-variant()
value.desc: Enables display of specific character variants.

value.name: contextual
value.desc: Enables display of contextual alternates.

value.name: historical-forms
value.desc: Enables display of historical forms.

value.name: no-contextual
value.desc: Disables display of contextual alternates.

value.name: ornaments()
value.desc: Enables replacement of default glyphs with ornaments, if provided in the font.

value.name: ruby
value.desc: Enables display of ruby glyphs. This value only selects a glyph for use in ruby text, it does not affect font scaling.

value.name: styleset()
value.desc: Enables display with stylistic sets.

value.name: stylistic()
value.desc: Enables display of stylistic alternates.

value.name: swash()
value.desc: Enables display of swash glyphs.

entry.name: font-variant-caps
entry.desc: Specifies control over capitalized forms.

value.name: all-petite-caps
value.desc: Enables display of petite capitals for both upper and lowercase letters.

value.name: all-small-caps
value.desc: Enables display of small capitals for both upper and lowercase letters.

value.name: petite-caps
value.desc: Enables display of petite capitals.

value.name: small-caps
value.desc: Enables display of small capitals. Small-caps glyphs typically use the form of uppercase letters but are reduced to the size of lowercase letters.

value.name: titling-caps
value.desc: Enables display of titling capitals.

value.name: unicase
value.desc: Enables display of mixture of small capitals for uppercase letters with normal lowercase letters.

entry.name: font-variant-east-asian
entry.desc: Allows control of glyph substitute and positioning in East Asian text.

value.name: full-width
value.desc: Enables rendering of full-width variants.

value.name: hojo-kanji
value.desc: Enables rendering of Hojo Kanji forms.

value.name: jis04
value.desc: Enables rendering of JIS04 forms.

value.name: jis78
value.desc: Enables rendering of JIS78 forms.

value.name: jis83
value.desc: Enables rendering of JIS83 forms.

value.name: jis90
value.desc: Enables rendering of JIS90 forms.

value.name: nlckanji
value.desc: Enables rendering of NLC Kanji forms.

value.name: proportional-width
value.desc: Enables rendering of proportionally-spaced variants.

value.name: simplified
value.desc: Enables rendering of simplified forms.

value.name: traditional
value.desc: Enables rendering of traditional forms.

entry.name: font-variant-ligatures
entry.desc: Specifies control over which ligatures are enabled or disabled. A value of normal implies that the defaults set by the font are used.

value.name: additional-ligatures
value.desc: Enables display of additional ligatures.

value.name: common-ligatures
value.desc: Enables display of common ligatures.

value.name: historical-ligatures
value.desc: Enables display of historical ligatures.

value.name: no-additional-ligatures
value.desc: Disables display of additional ligatures.

value.name: no-common-ligatures
value.desc: Disables display of common ligatures.

value.name: no-historical-ligatures
value.desc: Disables display of historical ligatures.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Implies that the defaults set by the font are used.

entry.name: font-variant-numeric
entry.desc: Specifies control over numerical forms.

value.name: diagonal-fractions
value.desc: Enables display of lining diagonal fractions.

value.name: lining-nums
value.desc: Enables display of lining numerals.

value.name: oldstyle-nums
value.desc: Enables display of old-style numerals.

value.name: proportional-nums
value.desc: Enables display of proportional numerals.

value.name: slashed-zero
value.desc: Enables display of slashed zeros.

value.name: stacked-fractions
value.desc: Enables display of lining stacked fractions.

value.name: tabular-nums
value.desc: Enables display of tabular numerals.

entry.name: font-variant-position
entry.desc: Specifies the vertical position

entry.name: font-weight
entry.desc: Specifies weight of glyphs in the font, their degree of blackness or stroke thickness.

value.desc: Thin
Extra Light (Ultra Light)
Light
Normal
Medium
Semi Bold (Demi Bold)
Bold
Extra Bold (Ultra Bold)
Black (Heavy)

value.name: bold
value.desc: Same as 700

value.name: bolder
value.desc: Specifies the weight of the face bolder than the inherited value.

value.name: lighter
value.desc: Specifies the weight of the face lighter than the inherited value.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Same as 400

entry.name: glyph-orientation-horizontal
entry.desc: Sets or retrieves a value that alters the orientation of a sequence of characters relative to an inline-progression-direction of horizontal.

entry.name: glyph-orientation-vertical
entry.desc: Sets or retrieves a value that alters the orientation of a sequence of characters relative to an inline-progression-direction of vertical.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Sets the orientation based on the fullwidth or non-fullwidth characters and the most common orientation.

entry.name: grid-cell
entry.desc: The grid-cell is valid on grid items and places the grid item inside the explicitly named grid cell.

entry.name: grid-column
entry.desc: grid-column is used to place grid items and explicitly defined grid cells in the Grid.

entry.name: grid-column-align
entry.desc: Aligns the columns in a grid.

value.name: center
value.desc: Places the center of the Grid Item's margin box at the center of the Grid Item's column.

value.name: end
value.desc: Aligns the end edge of the Grid Item's margin box to the end edge of the Grid Item's column.

value.name: start
value.desc: Aligns the starting edge of the Grid Item's margin box to the starting edge of the Grid Item's column.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: Ensures that the Grid Item's margin box is equal to the size of the Grid Item's column.

entry.name: grid-columns
entry.desc: Lays out the columns of the grid.

entry.name: grid-column-sizing
entry.desc: By default, any implicit columns or rows created are auto sized to content. The default size can be changed using the grid-column-sizing and grid-row-sizing properties.

entry.name: grid-column-span
entry.desc: Specifies the number of columns to span.

entry.name: grid-flow
entry.desc: Grid items can be automatically placed into an unoccupied space of the grid. The grid-flow property controls the direction in which the search for unoccupied space takes place.

entry.name: grid-row
entry.desc: grid-row is used to place grid items and explicitly defined grid cells in the Grid.

entry.name: grid-row-align
entry.desc: Aligns the rows in a grid.

value.name: center
value.desc: Places the center of the Grid Item's margin box at the center of the Grid Item's row.

value.name: end
value.desc: Aligns the end edge of the Grid Item's margin box to the end edge of the Grid Item's row.

value.name: start
value.desc: Aligns the starting edge of the Grid Item's margin box to the starting edge of the Grid Item's row.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: Ensures that the Grid Item's margin box is equal to the size of the Grid Item's row.

entry.name: grid-rows
entry.desc: Lays out the columns of the grid.

entry.name: grid-row-sizing
entry.desc: By default, any implicit columns or rows created are auto sized to content. The default size can be changed using the grid-column-sizing and grid-row-sizing properties.

entry.name: grid-row-span
entry.desc: Specifies the number of rows to span.

entry.name: grid-template
entry.desc: The grid-template property provides a visualization of the grid element's structure while simultaneously defining the grid cells which can be used to layer or stack the child elements of the grid.

entry.name: hanging-punctuation
entry.desc: Determines whether a punctuation mark, if one is present, may be placed outside the content area at the start or at the end of a full line of text.

value.name: allow-end
value.desc: Punctuation (specifically, stops and commas) may hang outside the end edge of all lines if the punctuation does not otherwise fit prior to justification.

value.name: first
value.desc: Punctuation (specifically, opening brackets and quotes) may hang outside the start edge of the first line.

value.name: force-end
value.desc: Punctuation (specifically, stops and commas) may hang outside the end edge of all lines. If justification is enabled on this line, then it will force the punctuation to hang.

value.name: none
value.desc: No characters can hang.

entry.name: height
entry.desc: Specifies the height of the content area, padding area or border area (depending on 'box-sizing') of certain boxes.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The height depends on the values of other properties.

entry.name: hyphens
entry.desc: This property controls whether hyphenation is allowed to create more break opportunities within a line of text.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Conditional hyphenation characters inside a word, if present, take priority over automatic resources when determining hyphenation points within the word.

value.name: manual
value.desc: Words are only broken at line breaks where there are characters inside the word that suggest line break opportunities

value.name: none
value.desc: Words are not broken at line breaks, even if characters inside the word suggest line break points.

entry.name: icon
entry.desc: Provides the author the ability to style any arbitrary element with an iconic equivalent. An element's icon is not used/rendered unless the 'content' property is set to the value 'icon'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Use a default generic icon provided by the user agent.

entry.name: image-orientation
entry.desc: This property specifies an orthogonal rotation to be applied to an image before it is laid out.

value.name: from-image
value.desc: If the image has an orientation specified in its metadata, such as EXIF, this value computes to the angle that the metadata specifies is necessary to correctly orient the image.

entry.name: image-rendering
entry.desc: The creator of SVG content might want to provide a hint to the implementation about how to make speed vs. quality tradeoffs as it performs image processing. The image-rendering property provides a hint to the SVG user agent about how to optimize its image rendering.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The image should be scaled with an algorithm that maximizes the appearance of the image.

value.name: crisp-edges
value.desc: The image must be scaled with an algorithm that preserves contrast and edges in the image, and which does not smooth colors or introduce blur to the image in the process.

value.name: pixelated
value.desc: When scaling the image up, the 'nearest neighbor' or similar algorithm must be used, so that the image appears to be simply composed of very large pixels.

entry.name: image-resolution
entry.desc: The 'image-resolution' property specifies the intrinsic resolution of all raster images used in or on the element.

value.name: from-image
value.desc: The image's intrinsic resolution is taken as that specified by the image format. If the image does not specify its own resolution, the explicitly specified resolution is used (if given), else it defaults to '1dppx'.

value.name: snap
value.desc: If the 'snap' keyword is provided, the computed resolution (if any) is the specified resolution rounded to the nearest value that would map one image pixel to an integer number of device pixels.

entry.name: ime-mode
entry.desc: Controls the state of the input method editor for text fields.

value.name: active
value.desc: The input method editor is initially active; text entry is performed using it unless the user specifically dismisses it.

value.name: auto
value.desc: No change is made to the current input method editor state. This is the default.

value.name: disabled
value.desc: The input method editor is disabled and may not be activated by the user.

value.name: inactive
value.desc: The input method editor is initially inactive, but the user may activate it if they wish.

value.name: normal
value.desc: The IME state should be normal; this value can be used in a user style sheet to override the page setting.

entry.name: justify-content
entry.desc: Aligns a flex container's lines within the flex container when there is extra space in the cross-axis, similar to how 'justify-content' aligns individual items within the main-axis.

entry.name: kerning
entry.desc: Indicates whether the user agent should adjust inter-glyph spacing based on kerning tables that are included in the relevant font or instead disable auto-kerning and set inter-character spacing to a specific length.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Indicates that the user agent should adjust inter-glyph spacing based on kerning tables that are included in the font that will be used.

entry.name: left
entry.desc: Specifies how far an absolutely positioned box's left margin edge is offset to the right of the left edge of the box's 'containing block'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well

entry.name: letter-spacing
entry.desc: Specifies the minimum, maximum, and optimal spacing between grapheme clusters.

value.name: normal
value.desc: The spacing is the normal spacing for the current font. It is typically zero-length.

entry.name: lighting-color
entry.desc: Defines the color of the light source for filter primitives 'feDiffuseLighting' and 'feSpecularLighting'.

value.name: ActiveBorder
value.desc: Active window border.

value.name: ActiveCaption
value.desc: Active window caption.

value.name: AppWorkspace
value.desc: Background color of multiple document interface.

value.name: Background
value.desc: Desktop background.

value.name: ButtonFace
value.desc: The face background color for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonHighlight
value.desc: The color of the border facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonShadow
value.desc: The color of the border away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonText
value.desc: Text on push buttons.

value.name: CaptionText
value.desc: Text in caption, size box, and scrollbar arrow box.

value.name: currentColor
value.desc: The value of the 'color' property. The computed value of the 'currentColor' keyword is the computed value of the 'color' property. If the 'currentColor' keyword is set on the 'color' property itself, it is treated as 'color:inherit' at parse time.

value.name: flavor
value.desc: The accent color (typically chosen by the user) to customize the user interface of the user agent itself.

value.name: GrayText
value.desc: Grayed (disabled) text. This color is set to #000 if the current display driver does not support a solid gray color.

value.name: Highlight
value.desc: Item(s) selected in a control.

value.name: HighlightText
value.desc: Text of item(s) selected in a control.

value.desc: Inactive window border.

value.desc: Color of text in an inactive caption.

value.desc: Background color for tooltip controls.

value.name: InfoText
value.desc: Text color for tooltip controls.

value.name: Menu
value.desc: Menu background.

value.name: MenuText
value.desc: Text in menus.

value.name: Scrollbar
value.desc: Scroll bar gray area.

value.name: ThreeDDarkShadow
value.desc: The color of the darker (generally outer) of the two borders away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDFace
value.desc: The face background color for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDHighlight
value.desc: The color of the lighter (generally outer) of the two borders facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDLightShadow
value.desc: The color of the darker (generally inner) of the two borders facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDShadow
value.desc: The color of the lighter (generally inner) of the two borders away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: transparent
value.desc: Fully transparent. This keyword can be considered a shorthand for rgba(0,0,0,0) which is its computed value.

value.name: Window
value.desc: Window background.

value.name: WindowFrame
value.desc: Window frame.

value.name: WindowText
value.desc: Text in windows.

entry.name: line-break
entry.desc: Specifies what set of line breaking restrictions are in effect within the element.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The UA determines the set of line-breaking restrictions to use for CJK scripts, and it may vary the restrictions based on the length of the line; e.g., use a less restrictive set of line-break rules for short lines.

value.name: loose
value.desc: Breaks text using the least restrictive set of line-breaking rules. Typically used for short lines, such as in newspapers.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Breaks text using the most common set of line-breaking rules.

value.name: strict
value.desc: Breaks CJK scripts using a more restrictive set of line-breaking rules than 'normal'.

entry.name: line-height
entry.desc: Determines the block-progression dimension of the text content area of an inline box.

value.name: none
value.desc: The computed value of the property is the ancestor block element font-size.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Tells user agents to set the computed value to a 'reasonable' value based on the font size of the element.

entry.name: list-style
entry.desc: Shorthand for setting 'list-style-type', 'list-style-position' and 'list-style-image'

value.name: circle
value.desc: A hollow circle.

value.name: disc
value.desc: A filled circle.

value.name: hanging
value.desc: As 'inside', except the marker is instead placed immediately before the first text or significant whitespace in the list item or its children

value.name: inside
value.desc: The marker box is outside the principal block box, as described in the section on the ::marker pseudo-element below.

value.name: outside
value.desc: The ::marker pseudo-element is an inline element placed immediately before all ::before pseudo-elements in the principal block box, after which the element's content flows.

value.name: square
value.desc: A filled square.

entry.name: list-style-image
entry.desc: Sets the image that will be used as the list item marker. When the image is available, it will replace the marker set with the 'list-style-type' marker.

entry.name: list-style-position
entry.desc: Specifies the position of the '::marker' pseudo-element's box in the list item.

value.name: hanging
value.desc: As 'inside', except the marker is instead placed immediately before the first text or significant whitespace in the list item or its children

value.name: inside
value.desc: The marker box is outside the principal block box, as described in the section on the ::marker pseudo-element below.

value.name: outside
value.desc: The ::marker pseudo-element is an inline element placed immediately before all ::before pseudo-elements in the principal block box, after which the element's content flows.

entry.name: list-style-type
entry.desc: Can be used to make an element look like a standard user interface element on the platform.

value.name: circle
value.desc: A hollow circle.

value.name: disc
value.desc: A filled circle.

value.name: square
value.desc: A filled square.

entry.name: margin
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: margin-bottom
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: margin-left
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: margin-right
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: margin-top
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: marker
entry.desc: Specifies the marker symbol that shall be used for all points on the sets the value for all vertices on the given path element or basic shape.

entry.name: marker-end
entry.desc: Defines the arrowhead or polymarker that shall be drawn at the final vertex.

entry.name: marker-mid
entry.desc: Defines the arrowhead or polymarker that shall be drawn at every other vertex.

entry.name: marker-start
entry.desc: Defines the arrowhead or polymarker that shall be drawn at the first vertex of the given path element or basic shape.

entry.name: mask
entry.desc: Allows authors to control under what circumstances (if any) a particular graphic element can become the target of mouse events.

entry.name: max-height
entry.desc: Allows authors to constrain content height to a certain range.

value.name: none
value.desc: No limit on the height of the box.

entry.name: max-width
entry.desc: Allows authors to constrain content width to a certain range.

value.name: none
value.desc: No limit on the width of the box.

entry.name: min-height
entry.desc: Allows authors to constrain content height to a certain range.

entry.name: min-width
entry.desc: Allows authors to constrain content width to a certain range.

entry.name: move-to
entry.desc: Property causes the element or pseudo-element to be removed from the flow and reinserted at a later point in the document.

value.name: here
value.desc: The element or pseudo-element is not moved. This value inhibits the creation of '::alternate' pseudo-elements and any pseudo-elements that have such a pseudo-element as a superior.

value.name: normal
value.desc: For '::alternate' pseudo-elements, if the superior parent uses the 'footnote' counter in its 'content' property then the computed value of 'move-to' is 'footnotes'.

entry.name: -moz-animation
entry.desc: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.

value.name: alternate
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

value.name: alternate-reverse
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

value.name: backwards
value.desc: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

value.name: both
value.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

value.name: cubic-bezier()
value.desc: Specifies a cubic-bezier curve. The four values specify points P1 and P2 of the curve as (x1, y1, x2, y2). All values must be in the range [0, 1].

value.name: ease
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.25, 0.1, 0.25, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in-out
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: ease-out
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: forwards
value.desc: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

value.name: infinite
value.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

value.name: linear
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: none
value.desc: No animation is performed

value.name: normal
value.desc: Normal playback.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

value.name: step-end
value.desc: The step-end function is equivalent to steps(1, end).

value.name: steps(1, start)
value.desc: The first parameter specifies the number of intervals in the function. The second parameter, which is optional, is either the value 'start' or 'end'.

value.name: step-start
value.desc: The step-start function is equivalent to steps(1, start).

entry.name: -moz-animation-delay
entry.desc: Defines when the animation will start. An 'animation-delay' value of '0' means the animation will execute as soon as it is applied. Otherwise, the value specifies an offset from the moment the animation is applied, and the animation will delay execution by that offset.

entry.name: -moz-animation-direction
entry.desc: Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.

value.name: alternate
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

value.name: alternate-reverse
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Normal playback.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

entry.name: -moz-animation-duration
entry.desc: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.

entry.name: -moz-animation-iteration-count
entry.desc: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.

value.name: infinite
value.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

entry.name: -moz-animation-name
entry.desc: Defines a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.

value.name: none
value.desc: No animation is performed

entry.name: -moz-animation-play-state
entry.desc: Defines whether the animation is running or paused.

value.name: paused
value.desc: A running animation will be paused.

value.name: running
value.desc: Resume playback of a paused animation.

entry.name: -moz-animation-timing-function
entry.desc: Describes how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration. See the 'transition-timing-function'.

value.name: cubic-bezier()
value.desc: Specifies a cubic-bezier curve. The four values specify points P1 and P2 of the curve as (x1, y1, x2, y2). All values must be in the range [0, 1].

value.name: ease
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.25, 0.1, 0.25, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in-out
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: ease-out
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: linear
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: step-end
value.desc: The step-end function is equivalent to steps(1, end).

value.name: steps(1, start)
value.desc: The first parameter specifies the number of intervals in the function. The second parameter, which is optional, is either the value 'start' or 'end'.

value.name: step-start
value.desc: The step-start function is equivalent to steps(1, start).

entry.name: -moz-appearance
entry.desc: The -moz-appearance CSS property is used in Gecko (Firefox) to display an element using a platform-native styling based on the operating system's theme.

entry.name: -moz-backface-visibility
entry.desc: Determines whether or not the 'back' side of a transformed element is visible when facing the viewer. With an identity transform, the front side of an element faces the viewer.

entry.name: -moz-background-clip
entry.desc: Determines the background painting area.

value.name: border-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the border box.

value.name: content-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the content box.

value.name: padding-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the padding box

entry.name: -moz-background-inline-policy
entry.desc: In Gecko-based applications like Firefox, the -moz-background-inline-policy CSS property specifies how the background image of an inline element is determined when the content of the inline element wraps onto multiple lines. The choice of position has significant effects on repetition.

entry.name: -moz-background-origin
entry.desc: For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the background positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes 'box-decoration-break' operates on to determine the background positioning area(s).

value.name: border-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the border box.

value.name: content-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the content box.

value.name: padding-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the padding box

entry.name: -moz-border-bottom-colors
entry.desc: In Mozilla applications like Firefox, -moz-border-bottom-colors sets a list of colors for the bottom border.

value.name: ActiveBorder
value.desc: Active window border.

value.name: ActiveCaption
value.desc: Active window caption.

value.name: AppWorkspace
value.desc: Background color of multiple document interface.

value.name: Background
value.desc: Desktop background.

value.name: ButtonFace
value.desc: The face background color for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonHighlight
value.desc: The color of the border facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonShadow
value.desc: The color of the border away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonText
value.desc: Text on push buttons.

value.name: CaptionText
value.desc: Text in caption, size box, and scrollbar arrow box.

value.name: currentColor
value.desc: The value of the 'color' property. The computed value of the 'currentColor' keyword is the computed value of the 'color' property. If the 'currentColor' keyword is set on the 'color' property itself, it is treated as 'color:inherit' at parse time.

value.name: flavor
value.desc: The accent color (typically chosen by the user) to customize the user interface of the user agent itself.

value.name: GrayText
value.desc: Grayed (disabled) text. This color is set to #000 if the current display driver does not support a solid gray color.

value.name: Highlight
value.desc: Item(s) selected in a control.

value.name: HighlightText
value.desc: Text of item(s) selected in a control.

value.name: InactiveBorder
value.desc: Inactive window border.

value.name: InactiveCaption
value.desc: Inactive window caption.

value.name: InactiveCaptionText
value.desc: Color of text in an inactive caption.

value.name: InfoBackground
value.desc: Background color for tooltip controls.

value.name: InfoText
value.desc: Text color for tooltip controls.

value.name: Menu
value.desc: Menu background.

value.name: MenuText
value.desc: Text in menus.

value.name: Scrollbar
value.desc: Scroll bar gray area.

value.name: ThreeDDarkShadow
value.desc: The color of the darker (generally outer) of the two borders away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDFace
value.desc: The face background color for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDHighlight
value.desc: The color of the lighter (generally outer) of the two borders facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDLightShadow
value.desc: The color of the darker (generally inner) of the two borders facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDShadow
value.desc: The color of the lighter (generally inner) of the two borders away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: transparent
value.desc: Fully transparent. This keyword can be considered a shorthand for rgba(0,0,0,0) which is its computed value.

value.name: Window
value.desc: Window background.

value.name: WindowFrame
value.desc: Window frame.

value.name: WindowText
value.desc: Text in windows.

entry.name: -moz-border-image
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

value.name: auto
value.desc: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved. (By default it is discarded, i.e., treated as empty.)

value.name: repeat
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

value.name: round
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

value.name: space
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: The image is stretched to fill the area.
