entry.name: -ms-scroll-chaining
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that indicates the scrolling behavior that occurs when a user hits the content boundary during a manipulation.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-limit
entry.desc: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-scroll-limit-x-min, -ms-scroll-limit-y-min, -ms-scroll-limit-x-max, and -ms-scroll-limit-y-max properties.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-limit-x-max
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum value for the scrollLeft property.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-limit-x-min
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum value for the scrollLeft property.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-limit-y-max
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum value for the scrollTop property.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-limit-y-min
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum value for the scrollTop property.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-rails
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether or not small motions perpendicular to the primary axis of motion will result in either changes to both the scrollTop and scrollLeft properties or a change to the primary axis (for instance, either the scrollTop or scrollLeft properties will change, but not both).

entry.name: -ms-scroll-snap-points-x
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that defines where snap-points will be located along the x-axis.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-snap-points-y
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that defines where snap-points will be located along the y-axis.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-snap-type
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that defines what type of snap-point should be used for the current element. There are two type of snap-points, with the primary difference being whether or not the user is guaranteed to always stop on a snap-point.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-snap-x
entry.desc: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-scroll-snap-type and -ms-scroll-snap-points-x properties.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-snap-y
entry.desc: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-scroll-snap-type and -ms-scroll-snap-points-y properties.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-translation
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether vertical-to-horizontal scroll wheel translation occurs on the specified element.

entry.name: -ms-text-align-last
entry.desc: Describes how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'.

value.name: center
value.desc: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

value.name: end
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the end edge of the line box.

value.name: justify
value.desc: The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.

value.name: left
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.

value.name: right
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

value.name: start
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the start edge of the line box.

entry.name: -ms-text-autospace
entry.desc: Determines whether or not a full-width punctuation mark character should be trimmed if it appears at the beginning of a line, so that its 'ink' lines up with the first glyph in the line above and below.

value.name: ideograph-alpha
value.desc: Creates 1/4em extra spacing between runs of ideographic letters and non-ideographic letters, such as Latin-based, Cyrillic, Greek, Arabic or Hebrew.

value.name: ideograph-numeric
value.desc: Creates 1/4em extra spacing between runs of ideographic letters and numeric glyphs.

value.name: ideograph-parenthesis
value.desc: Creates extra spacing between normal (non wide) parenthesis and ideographs.

value.name: ideograph-space
value.desc: Extends the width of the space character while surrounded by ideographs.

value.name: none
value.desc: No extra space is created.

value.name: punctuation
value.desc: Creates extra non-breaking spacing around punctuation as required by language-specific typographic conventions.

entry.name: -ms-text-justify
entry.desc: Selects the justification algorithm used when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'. The property applies to block containers, but the UA may (but is not required to) also support it on inline elements.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The UA determines the justification algorithm to follow, based on a balance between performance and adequate presentation quality.

value.name: distribute
value.desc: Justification primarily changes spacing both at word separators and at grapheme cluster boundaries in all scripts except those in the connected and cursive groups. This value is sometimes used in e.g. Japanese, often with the 'text-align-last' property.

value.name: inter-cluster
value.desc: Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators and at grapheme cluster boundaries in clustered scripts. This value is typically used for Southeast Asian scripts such as Thai.

value.name: inter-ideograph
value.desc: Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators and at inter-graphemic boundaries in scripts that use no word spaces. This value is typically used for CJK languages.

value.name: inter-word
value.desc: Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators. This value is typically used for languages that separate words using spaces, like English or (sometimes) Korean.

value.name: kashida
value.desc: Justification primarily stretches Arabic and related scripts through the use of kashida or other calligraphic elongation.

value.name: none
value.desc: Justification is disabled.

value.name: trim
value.desc: Specifies that compression is preferred to expansion and enables the trimming of blank space in glyphs where allowed by typographic tradition.

entry.name: -ms-text-kashida-space
entry.desc: Sets or retrieves the ratio of kashida expansion to white space expansion when justifying lines of text in the object.

entry.name: -ms-text-overflow
entry.desc: Text can overflow for example when it is prevented from wrapping

value.name: clip
value.desc: Clip inline content that overflows. Characters may be only partially rendered.

value.name: ellipsis
value.desc: Render an ellipsis character (U+2026) to represent clipped inline content.

entry.name: -ms-text-size-adjust
entry.desc: Specifies a size adjustment for displaying text content in mobile browsers.

entry.name: -ms-text-underline-position
entry.desc: Sets the position of an underline specified on the same element: it does not affect underlines specified by ancestor elements.This property is typically used in vertical writing contexts such as in Japanese documents where it often desired to have the underline appear 'over' (to the right of) the affected run of text

value.name: alphabetic
value.desc: The underline is aligned with the alphabetic baseline. In this case the underline is likely to cross some descenders.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent may use any algorithm to determine the underline's position. In horizontal line layout, the underline should be aligned as for alphabetic. In vertical line layout, if the language is set to Japanese or Korean, the underline should be aligned as for over.

value.name: over
value.desc: The underline is aligned with the 'top' (right in vertical writing) edge of the element's em-box. In this mode, an overline also switches sides.

value.name: under
value.desc: The underline is aligned with the 'bottom' (left in vertical writing) edge of the element's em-box. In this case the underline usually does not cross the descenders. This is sometimes called 'accounting' underline.

entry.name: -ms-touch-action
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether and how a given region can be manipulated by the user.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The element is a passive element, with several exceptions.

value.name: double-tap-zoom
value.desc: The element will zoom on double-tap.

value.name: manipulation
value.desc: The element is a manipulation-causing element.

value.name: none
value.desc: The element is a manipulation-blocking element.

value.name: pan-x
value.desc: The element permits touch-driven panning on the horizontal axis. The touch pan is performed on the nearest ancestor with horizontally scrollable content.

value.name: pan-y
value.desc: The element permits touch-driven panning on the vertical axis. The touch pan is performed on the nearest ancestor with vertically scrollable content.

value.name: pinch-zoom
value.desc: The element permits pinch-zooming. The pinch-zoom is performed on the nearest ancestor with zoomable content.

entry.name: -ms-touch-select
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that toggles the 'gripper' visual elements that enable touch text selection.

value.name: grippers
value.desc: Grippers are always on.

value.name: none
value.desc: Grippers are always off.

entry.name: -ms-transform
entry.desc: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

value.name: matrix()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]

value.name: matrix3d()
value.desc: specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.

value.name: rotate()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.

value.name: rotate3d()
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.

value.name: rotateX('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.

value.name: rotateY('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.

value.name: rotateZ('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.

value.name: scale()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.

value.name: scale3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.

value.name: scaleX()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.

value.name: scaleY()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.

value.name: scaleZ()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

value.name: skew()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).

value.name: skewX()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.

value.name: skewY()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.

value.name: translate()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.

value.name: translate3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.

value.name: translateX()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.

value.name: translateY()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.

value.name: translateZ()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.

entry.name: -ms-transform-origin
entry.desc: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element. This property is applied by first translating the element by the negated value of the property, then applying the element's transform, then translating by the property value.

entry.name: -ms-transform-origin-x
entry.desc: The x coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

entry.name: -ms-transform-origin-y
entry.desc: The y coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

entry.name: -ms-transform-origin-z
entry.desc: The z coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

entry.name: -ms-user-select
entry.desc: Controls the appearance of selection.

entry.name: -ms-word-break
entry.desc: Specifies line break opportunities for non-CJK scripts.

value.name: break-all
value.desc: Lines may break between any two grapheme clusters for non-CJK scripts. This option is used mostly in a context where the text is predominantly using CJK characters with few non-CJK excerpts and it is desired that the text be better distributed on each line.

value.name: keep-all
value.desc: Block characters can no longer create implied break points. Otherwise this option is equivalent to 'normal'. This option is mostly used where the presence of word separator characters still creates line-breaking opportunities, as in Korean.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Breaks non-CJK scripts according to their own rules.

entry.name: -ms-word-wrap
entry.desc: Specifies whether the UA may break within a word to prevent overflow when an otherwise-unbreakable string is too long to fit.

value.name: break-word
value.desc: An unbreakable 'word' may be broken at an arbitrary point if there are no otherwise-acceptable break points in the line.

value.name: hyphenate
value.desc: An unbreakable 'word' may be hyphenated if there are no otherwise-acceptable break points in the line even if hyphenation is turned off.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Lines may break only at allowed break points.

entry.name: -ms-wrap-flow
entry.desc: An element becomes an exclusion when its 'wrap-flow' property has a computed value other than 'auto'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For floats an exclusion is created, for all other elements an exclusion is not created.

value.name: both
value.desc: Inline flow content can flow on all sides of the exclusion.

value.name: clear
value.desc: Inline flow content can only wrap on top and bottom of the exclusion and must leave the areas to the start and end edges of the exclusion box empty.

value.name: end
value.desc: Inline flow content can wrap on the end side of the exclusion area but must leave the area to the start edge of the exclusion area empty.

value.name: maximum
value.desc: Inline flow content can wrap on the side of the exclusion with the largest available space for the given line, and must leave the other side of the exclusion empty.

value.name: start
value.desc: Inline flow content can wrap on the start edge of the exclusion area but must leave the area to end edge of the exclusion area empty.

entry.name: -ms-wrap-margin
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that is used to offset the inner wrap shape from other shapes.

entry.name: -ms-wrap-through
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies how content should wrap around an exclusion element.

value.name: none
value.desc: The exclusion element does not inherit its parent node's wrapping context. Its descendants are only subject to exclusion shapes defined inside the element.

value.name: wrap
value.desc: The exclusion element inherits its parent node's wrapping context. Its descendant inline content wraps around exclusions defined outside the element.

entry.name: -ms-writing-mode
entry.desc: This is a shorthand property for both 'direction' and 'block-progression'.

entry.name: -ms-zoom
entry.desc: Sets or retrieves the magnification scale of the object.

entry.name: -ms-zoom-animation
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether an animation is used when zooming.

entry.name: nav-down
entry.desc: Provides an way to control directional focus navigation.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent automatically determines which element to navigate the focus to in response to directional navigational input.

entry.name: nav-index
entry.desc: Provides an input-method-neutral way of specifying the sequential navigation order (also known as 'tabbing order').

value.name: auto
value.desc: The element's sequential navigation order is assigned automatically by the user agent.

entry.name: nav-left
entry.desc: Provides an way to control directional focus navigation.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent automatically determines which element to navigate the focus to in response to directional navigational input.

entry.name: nav-right
entry.desc: Provides an way to control directional focus navigation.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent automatically determines which element to navigate the focus to in response to directional navigational input.

entry.name: nav-up
entry.desc: Provides an way to control directional focus navigation.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent automatically determines which element to navigate the focus to in response to directional navigational input.

entry.name: -o-animation
entry.desc: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.

value.name: alternate
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

value.name: alternate-reverse
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

value.name: backwards
value.desc: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

value.name: both
value.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

value.name: cubic-bezier()
value.desc: Specifies a cubic-bezier curve. The four values specify points P1 and P2 of the curve as (x1, y1, x2, y2). All values must be in the range [0, 1].

value.name: ease
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.25, 0.1, 0.25, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in-out
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: ease-out
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: forwards
value.desc: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

value.name: infinite
value.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

value.name: linear
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: none
value.desc: No animation is performed

value.name: normal
value.desc: Normal playback.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

value.name: step-end
value.desc: The step-end function is equivalent to steps(1, end).

value.name: steps(1, start)
value.desc: The first parameter specifies the number of intervals in the function. The second parameter, which is optional, is either the value 'start' or 'end'.

value.name: step-start
value.desc: The step-start function is equivalent to steps(1, start).

entry.name: -o-animation-delay
entry.desc: Defines when the animation will start. An 'animation-delay' value of '0' means the animation will execute as soon as it is applied. Otherwise, the value specifies an offset from the moment the animation is applied, and the animation will delay execution by that offset.

entry.name: -o-animation-direction
entry.desc: Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.

value.name: alternate
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

value.name: alternate-reverse
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Normal playback.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

entry.name: -o-animation-duration
entry.desc: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.

entry.name: -o-animation-fill-mode
entry.desc: Defines what values are applied by the animation outside the time it is executing.

value.name: backwards
value.desc: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

value.name: both
value.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

value.name: forwards
value.desc: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

value.name: none
value.desc: There is no change to the property value between the time the animation is applied and the time the animation begins playing or after the animation completes.

entry.name: -o-animation-iteration-count
entry.desc: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.

value.name: infinite
value.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

entry.name: -o-animation-name
entry.desc: Defines a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.

value.name: none
value.desc: No animation is performed

entry.name: -o-animation-play-state
entry.desc: Defines whether the animation is running or paused.

value.name: paused
value.desc: A running animation will be paused.

value.name: running
value.desc: Resume playback of a paused animation.

entry.name: -o-animation-timing-function
entry.desc: Describes how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration. See the 'transition-timing-function'.

value.name: cubic-bezier()
value.desc: Specifies a cubic-bezier curve. The four values specify points P1 and P2 of the curve as (x1, y1, x2, y2). All values must be in the range [0, 1].

value.name: ease
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.25, 0.1, 0.25, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in-out
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: ease-out
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: linear
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: step-end
value.desc: The step-end function is equivalent to steps(1, end).

value.name: steps(1, start)
value.desc: The first parameter specifies the number of intervals in the function. The second parameter, which is optional, is either the value 'start' or 'end'.

value.name: step-start
value.desc: The step-start function is equivalent to steps(1, start).

entry.name: object-fit
entry.desc: The object-fit property specifies how the contents of a replaced element should be scaled relative to the box established by its used height and width.

entry.name: object-position
entry.desc: Determines the alignment of the replaced element inside its box.

entry.name: -o-border-image
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

value.name: auto
value.desc: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved. (By default it is discarded, i.e., treated as empty.)

value.name: repeat
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

value.name: round
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

value.name: space
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: The image is stretched to fill the area.

entry.name: -o-object-fit
entry.desc: The object-fit property specifies how the contents of a replaced element should be scaled relative to the box established by its used height and width.

entry.name: -o-object-position
entry.desc: Determines the alignment of the replaced element inside its box.

entry.name: opacity
entry.desc: Opacity of an element's text, where 1 is opaque and 0 is entirely transparent.

entry.name: order
entry.desc: Controls the order in which flex items appear within their flex container, by assigning them to ordinal groups.

entry.name: orphans
entry.desc: Specifies the minimum number of lines in a block element that must be left at the bottom of a page.

entry.name: -o-table-baseline
entry.desc: Determines which row of a inline-table should be used as baseline of inline-table.

entry.name: -o-tab-size
entry.desc: This property determines the width of the tab character (U+0009), in space characters (U+0020), when rendered

entry.name: -o-text-overflow
entry.desc: Text can overflow for example when it is prevented from wrapping

value.name: clip
value.desc: Clip inline content that overflows. Characters may be only partially rendered.

value.name: ellipsis
value.desc: Render an ellipsis character (U+2026) to represent clipped inline content.

entry.name: -o-transform
entry.desc: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

value.name: matrix()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]

value.name: matrix3d()
value.desc: specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.

value.name: rotate()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.

value.name: rotate3d()
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.

value.name: rotateX('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.

value.name: rotateY('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.

value.name: rotateZ('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.

value.name: scale()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.

value.name: scale3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.

value.name: scaleX()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.

value.name: scaleY()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.

value.name: scaleZ()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

value.name: skew()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).

value.name: skewX()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.

value.name: skewY()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.

value.name: translate()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.

value.name: translate3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.

value.name: translateX()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.

value.name: translateY()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.

value.name: translateZ()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.

entry.name: -o-transform-origin
entry.desc: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element. This property is applied by first translating the element by the negated value of the property, then applying the element's transform, then translating by the property value.

entry.name: -o-transition
entry.desc: Shorthand property combines four of the transition properties into a single property.

value.name: all
value.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

value.name: cubic-bezier()
value.desc: Specifies a cubic-bezier curve. The four values specify points P1 and P2 of the curve as (x1, y1, x2, y2). All values must be in the range [0, 1].

value.name: ease
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.25, 0.1, 0.25, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in-out
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: ease-out
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: linear
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: none
value.desc: No property will transition.

value.name: step-end
value.desc: The step-end function is equivalent to steps(1, end).

value.name: steps(1, start)
value.desc: The first parameter specifies the number of intervals in the function. The second parameter, which is optional, is either the value 'start' or 'end'.

value.name: step-start
value.desc: The step-start function is equivalent to steps(1, start).

entry.name: -o-transition-delay
entry.desc: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.

entry.name: -o-transition-duration
entry.desc: Specifies how long the transition from the old value to the new value should take.

entry.name: -o-transition-property
entry.desc: Specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.

value.name: all
value.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

value.name: none
value.desc: No property will transition.

entry.name: -o-transition-timing-function
entry.desc: Describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated.

value.name: cubic-bezier()
value.desc: Specifies a cubic-bezier curve. The four values specify points P1 and P2 of the curve as (x1, y1, x2, y2). All values must be in the range [0, 1].

value.name: ease
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.25, 0.1, 0.25, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in-out
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: ease-out
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: linear
value.desc: Equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: step-end
value.desc: The step-end function is equivalent to steps(1, end).

value.name: steps(1, start)
value.desc: The first parameter specifies the number of intervals in the function. The second parameter, which is optional, is either the value 'start' or 'end'.

value.name: step-start
value.desc: The step-start function is equivalent to steps(1, start).

entry.name: outline
entry.desc: Shorthand property, and sets all three of 'outline-style', 'outline-width', and 'outline-color'.

value.name: dashed
value.desc: A series of square-ended dashes.

value.name: dotted
value.desc: A series of round dots.

value.name: double
value.desc: Two parallel solid lines with some space between them. (The thickness of the lines is not specified, but the sum of the lines and the space must equal 'border-width'.)

value.name: groove
value.desc: Looks as if it were carved in the canvas. (This is typically achieved by creating a "shadow" from two colors that are slightly lighter and darker than the 'border-color'.)

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Same as 'none', but has different behavior in the border conflict resolution rules for border-collapsed tables.

value.name: inset
value.desc: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is sunken into the canvas. Treated as 'ridge' in border-collapsed tables.

value.name: invert
value.desc: 'Invert' is expected to perform a color inversion on the pixels on the screen. This is a common way to ensure the focus border is visible, regardless of color background.

value.name: none
value.desc: No border. Color and width are ignored (i.e., the border has width 0, unless the border is an image)

value.name: outset
value.desc: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is coming out of the canvas. Treated as 'groove' in border-collapsed tables.

value.name: ridge
value.desc: Looks as if it were coming out of the canvas.

value.name: solid
value.desc: A single line segment.

entry.name: outline-color
entry.desc: The color of the outline

value.name: ActiveBorder
value.desc: Active window border.

value.name: ActiveCaption
value.desc: Active window caption.

value.name: AppWorkspace
value.desc: Background color of multiple document interface.

value.name: Background
value.desc: Desktop background.

value.name: ButtonFace
value.desc: The face background color for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonHighlight
value.desc: The color of the border facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonShadow
value.desc: The color of the border away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to one layer of surrounding border.

value.name: ButtonText
value.desc: Text on push buttons.

value.name: CaptionText
value.desc: Text in caption, size box, and scrollbar arrow box.

value.name: currentColor
value.desc: The value of the 'color' property. The computed value of the 'currentColor' keyword is the computed value of the 'color' property. If the 'currentColor' keyword is set on the 'color' property itself, it is treated as 'color:inherit' at parse time.

value.name: flavor
value.desc: The accent color (typically chosen by the user) to customize the user interface of the user agent itself.

value.name: GrayText
value.desc: Grayed (disabled) text. This color is set to #000 if the current display driver does not support a solid gray color.

value.name: Highlight
value.desc: Item(s) selected in a control.

value.name: HighlightText
value.desc: Text of item(s) selected in a control.

value.name: InactiveBorder
value.desc: Inactive window border.

value.name: InactiveCaption
value.desc: Inactive window caption.

value.name: InactiveCaptionText
value.desc: Color of text in an inactive caption.

value.name: InfoBackground
value.desc: Background color for tooltip controls.

value.name: InfoText
value.desc: Text color for tooltip controls.

value.name: invert
value.desc: 'Invert' is expected to perform a color inversion on the pixels on the screen. This is a common way to ensure the focus border is visible, regardless of color background.

value.name: Menu
value.desc: Menu background.

value.name: MenuText
value.desc: Text in menus.

value.name: Scrollbar
value.desc: Scroll bar gray area.

value.name: ThreeDDarkShadow
value.desc: The color of the darker (generally outer) of the two borders away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDFace
value.desc: The face background color for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDHighlight
value.desc: The color of the lighter (generally outer) of the two borders facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDLightShadow
value.desc: The color of the darker (generally inner) of the two borders facing the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: ThreeDShadow
value.desc: The color of the lighter (generally inner) of the two borders away from the light source for 3-D elements that appear 3-D due to two concentric layers of surrounding border.

value.name: transparent
value.desc: Fully transparent. This keyword can be considered a shorthand for rgba(0,0,0,0) which is its computed value.

value.name: Window
value.desc: Window background.

value.name: WindowFrame
value.desc: Window frame.

value.name: WindowText
value.desc: Text in windows.

entry.name: outline-offset
entry.desc: Width of the outline

entry.name: outline-style
entry.desc: Style of the outline

value.name: dashed
value.desc: A series of square-ended dashes.

value.name: dotted
value.desc: A series of round dots.

value.name: double
value.desc: Two parallel solid lines with some space between them. (The thickness of the lines is not specified, but the sum of the lines and the space must equal 'border-width'.)

value.name: groove
value.desc: Looks as if it were carved in the canvas. (This is typically achieved by creating a "shadow" from two colors that are slightly lighter and darker than the 'border-color'.)

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Same as 'none', but has different behavior in the border conflict resolution rules for border-collapsed tables.

value.name: inset
value.desc: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is sunken into the canvas. Treated as 'ridge' in border-collapsed tables.

value.name: none
value.desc: No border. Color and width are ignored (i.e., the border has width 0, unless the border is an image)

value.name: outset
value.desc: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is coming out of the canvas. Treated as 'groove' in border-collapsed tables.

value.name: ridge
value.desc: Looks as if it were coming out of the canvas.

value.name: solid
value.desc: A single line segment.

entry.name: outline-width
entry.desc: Width of the outline

entry.name: overflow
entry.desc: Shorthand for setting 'overflow-x' and 'overflow-y'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The behavior of the 'auto' value is UA-dependent, but should cause a scrolling mechanism to be provided for overflowing boxes.

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Content is clipped and no scrolling mechanism should be provided to view the content outside the clipping region.

value.name: no-content
value.desc: When the content doesn't fit in the content box, the whole content is hidden, as if 'visibility: hidden' were specified.

value.name: no-display
value.desc: When the content doesn't fit in the content box, the whole box is removed, as if 'display: none' were specified.

value.name: scroll
value.desc: Content is clipped and if the user agent uses a scrolling mechanism that is visible on the screen (such as a scroll bar or a panner), that mechanism should be displayed for a box whether or not any of its content is clipped.

value.name: visible
value.desc: Content is not clipped, i.e., it may be rendered outside the content box.

entry.name: overflow-wrap
entry.desc: This property specifies whether the UA may break within a word to prevent overflow when an otherwise-unbreakable string is too long to fit within the line box.

entry.name: overflow-x
entry.desc: Specify whether content is clipped when it overflows the element's content area.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The behavior of the 'auto' value is UA-dependent, but should cause a scrolling mechanism to be provided for overflowing boxes.

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Content is clipped and no scrolling mechanism should be provided to view the content outside the clipping region.

value.name: no-content
value.desc: When the content doesn't fit in the content box, the whole content is hidden, as if 'visibility: hidden' were specified.

value.name: no-display
value.desc: When the content doesn't fit in the content box, the whole box is removed, as if 'display: none' were specified.

value.name: scroll
value.desc: Content is clipped and if the user agent uses a scrolling mechanism that is visible on the screen (such as a scroll bar or a panner), that mechanism should be displayed for a box whether or not any of its content is clipped.

value.name: visible
value.desc: Content is not clipped, i.e., it may be rendered outside the content box.

entry.name: overflow-y
entry.desc: Specify whether content is clipped when it overflows the element's content area.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The behavior of the 'auto' value is UA-dependent, but should cause a scrolling mechanism to be provided for overflowing boxes.

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Content is clipped and no scrolling mechanism should be provided to view the content outside the clipping region.

value.name: no-content
value.desc: When the content doesn't fit in the content box, the whole content is hidden, as if 'visibility: hidden' were specified.

value.name: no-display
value.desc: When the content doesn't fit in the content box, the whole box is removed, as if 'display: none' were specified.

value.name: scroll
value.desc: Content is clipped and if the user agent uses a scrolling mechanism that is visible on the screen (such as a scroll bar or a panner), that mechanism should be displayed for a box whether or not any of its content is clipped.

value.name: visible
value.desc: Content is not clipped, i.e., it may be rendered outside the content box.

entry.name: padding
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: padding-bottom
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: padding-left
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: padding-right
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: padding-top
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: page
entry.desc: Specifies a particular type of page where an element SHOULD be displayed

entry.name: page-break-after
entry.desc: Defines rules for page breaks after an element.

value.name: always
value.desc: Always force a page break after the generated box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page break after generated box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a page break after the generated box.

value.name: left
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

value.name: right
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

entry.name: page-break-before
entry.desc: Defines rules for page breaks before an element.

value.name: always
value.desc: Always force a page break before the generated box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page break before the generated box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a page break before the generated box.

value.name: left
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

value.name: right
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

entry.name: page-break-inside
entry.desc: Defines rules for page breaks inside an element.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page break inside the generated box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a page break inside the generated box.

entry.name: page-policy
entry.desc: Determines which page-based occurrence of a given element is applied to a counter or string value.

value.name: first
value.desc: Takes the value after the first state change in the counter or string during processing of the page.

value.name: last
value.desc: Takes the value following the final state change on the page.

value.name: start
value.desc: Takes the value of the counter or string at the beginning of the page (before applying style to the elements of the page, but after applying it to the @page context itself).

entry.name: paint-order
entry.desc: Controls the order that the three paint operations that shapes and text are rendered with: their fill, their stroke and any markers they might have.

entry.name: pause
entry.desc: Shorthand for setting 'pause-before' and 'pause-after'. If two values are given, the first value is 'pause-before' and the second is 'pause-after'. If only one value is given, it applies to both properties.

entry.name: pause-after
entry.desc: Specifies a pause or prosodic boundary to be observed after an element or, if any 'cue-after' is specified, after these. Values indicate the prosodic strength of the break in speech output.

entry.name: pause-before
entry.desc: Specifies a pause or prosodic boundary to be observed before an element or, if any 'cue-before' is specified, before these. Values indicate the prosodic strength of the break in speech output.

entry.name: perspective
entry.desc: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.

value.name: none
value.desc: No perspective transform is applied.

entry.name: perspective-origin
entry.desc: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X and Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

entry.name: pitch
entry.desc: Specifies the average pitch (a frequency) of the speaking voice. The average pitch of a voice depends on the voice family. For example, the average pitch for a standard male voice is around 120Hz, but for a female voice, it's around 210Hz.

value.name: medium
value.desc: Equivalent to 100% and means the normal pitch for this voice

entry.name: pitch-range
entry.desc: Specifies variation in average pitch. The perceived pitch of a human voice is determined by the fundamental frequency and typically has a value of 120Hz for a male voice and 210Hz for a female voice.

entry.name: pointer-events
entry.desc: Allows authors to control under what circumstances (if any) a particular graphic element can become the target of mouse events.

value.name: absolute
value.desc: The box's position (and possibly size) is specified with the 'top', 'right', 'bottom', and 'left' properties. These properties specify offsets with respect to the box's 'containing block'.

value.name: center
value.desc: Center positioned boxes are taken out of the normal flow. This means they have no impact on the layout of later siblings.

value.name: fixed
value.desc: The box's position is calculated according to the 'absolute' model, but in addition, the box is fixed with respect to some reference. As with the 'absolute' model, the box's margins do not collapse with any other margins.

value.name: -ms-page
value.desc: The box's position is calculated according to the 'absolute' model.

value.name: page
value.desc: The box's position is calculated according to the 'absolute' model.

value.name: relative
value.desc: The box's position is calculated according to the normal flow (this is called the position in normal flow). Then the box is offset relative to its normal position.

value.name: static
value.desc: The box is a normal box, laid out according to the normal flow. The 'top', 'right', 'bottom', and 'left' properties do not apply.

value.name: sticky
value.desc: The box's position is calculated according to the normal flow. Then the box is offset relative to its flow root and containing block and in all cases, including table elements, does not affect the position of any following boxes.

entry.name: quotes
entry.desc: Specifies quotation marks for any number of embedded quotations.

value.name: none
value.desc: The 'open-quote' and 'close-quote' values of the 'content' property produce no quotations marks, as if they were 'no-open-quote' and 'no-close-quote' respectively.

entry.name: region-fragment
entry.desc: The 'region-fragment' property controls the behavior of the last region associated with a named flow.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Content flows as it would in a regular content box.

value.name: break
value.desc: If the content fits within the CSS Region, then this property has no effect.

entry.name: resize
entry.desc: Allows control over the appearance and function of the resizing mechanism (e.g. a resize box or widget) on the element. Applies to elements with 'overflow' other than 'visible'.

value.name: both
value.desc: The UA presents a bidirectional resizing mechanism to allow the user to adjust both the height and the width of the element.

value.name: horizontal
value.desc: The UA presents a unidirectional horizontal resizing mechanism to allow the user to adjust only the width of the element.

value.name: none
value.desc: The UA does not present a resizing mechanism on the element, and the user is given no direct manipulation mechanism to resize the element.

value.name: vertical
value.desc: The UA presents a unidirectional vertical resizing mechanism to allow the user to adjust only the height of the element.

entry.name: rest
entry.desc: Shorthand for setting 'rest-before' and 'rest-after'. If two values are given, the first value is 'rest-before' and the second is 'rest-after'. If only one value is given, it applies to both properties.

entry.name: rest-after
entry.desc: Specifies a rest or prosodic boundary to be observed after an element's content.

entry.name: rest-before
entry.desc: Specifies a rest or prosodic boundary to be observed before an element's content.

entry.name: richness
entry.syntax: A value between '0' and '100'. The higher the value, the more the voice will carry. A lower value will produce a soft, mellifluous voice.
entry.desc: Specifies the richness, or brightness, of the speaking voice. A rich voice will 'carry' in a large room, a smooth voice will not.

entry.name: right
entry.desc: Specifies how far an absolutely positioned box's right margin edge is offset to the left of the right edge of the box's 'containing block'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well

entry.name: rotation
entry.desc: Rotates a block-level element counterclockwise around the point given by 'rotation-point'.

entry.name: rotation-point
entry.desc: Pair of values that defines a point as an offset from the top left border edge. Initial value is 50% 50%.

entry.name: ruby-align
entry.syntax: auto | start | left | center | end | right | distribute-letter | distribute-space | line-edge
entry.desc: This property can be used on any element to control the text alignment of the ruby text and ruby base contents relative to each other.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent determines how the ruby contents are aligned. This is the initial value.

value.name: center
value.desc: The ruby text content is centered within the width of the base. If the length of the base is smaller than the length of the ruby text, then the base is centered within the width of the ruby text.

value.name: distribute-letter
value.desc: If the width of the ruby text is smaller than that of the base, then the ruby text contents are evenly distributed across the width of the base, with the first and last ruby text glyphs lining up with the corresponding first and last base glyphs. If the width of the ruby text is at least the width of the base, then the letters of the base are evenly distributed across the width of the ruby text.

value.name: distribute-space
value.desc: If the width of the ruby text is smaller than that of the base, then the ruby text contents are evenly distributed across the width of the base, with a certain amount of white space preceding the first and following the last character in the ruby text. That amount of white space is normally equal to half the amount of inter-character space of the ruby text.

value.name: end
value.desc: The ruby text content is aligned with the end edge of the base.

value.name: left
value.desc: The ruby text content is aligned with the start edge of the base.

value.name: line-edge
value.desc: If the ruby text is not adjacent to a line edge, it is aligned as in 'auto'. If it is adjacent to a line edge, then it is still aligned as in auto, but the side of the ruby text that touches the end of the line is lined up with the corresponding edge of the base.

value.name: right
value.desc: The ruby text content is aligned with the end edge of the base.

value.name: start
value.desc: The ruby text content is aligned with the start edge of the base.

entry.name: ruby-overhang
entry.desc: Determines whether, and on which side, ruby text is allowed to partially overhang any adjacent text in addition to its own base, when the ruby text is wider than the ruby base.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The ruby text can overhang text adjacent to the base on either side. This is the initial value.

value.name: end
value.desc: The ruby text can overhang the text that follows it.

value.name: none
value.desc: The ruby text cannot overhang any text adjacent to its base, only its own base.

value.name: start
value.desc: The ruby text can overhang the text that precedes it.

entry.name: ruby-position
entry.desc: This property is used by the parent of elements with display: ruby-text to control the position of the ruby text with respect to its base.

value.name: after
value.desc: The ruby text appears after the base. This is a relatively rare setting used in ideographic East Asian writing systems, most easily found in educational text.

value.name: before
value.desc: The ruby text appears before the base. This is the most common setting used in ideographic East Asian writing systems.

value.name: right
value.desc: The ruby text appears on the right of the base. Unlike 'before' and 'after', this value is not relative to the text flow direction.

entry.name: ruby-span
entry.desc: Determines whether, and on which side, ruby text is allowed to partially overhang any adjacent text in addition to its own base, when the ruby text is wider than the ruby base.

value.name: attr(x)
value.desc: The value of attribute 'x' is a string value. The string value is evaluated as a <number> to determine the number of ruby base elements to be spanned by the annotation element.

value.name: none
value.desc: No spanning. The computed value is '1'.

entry.name: scrollbar-3dlight-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

value.name: flavor

entry.name: shape-image-threshold
entry.desc: Defines the alpha channel threshold used to extract the shape using an image. A value of 0.5 means that the shape will enclose all the pixels that are more than 50% opaque.

entry.name: shape-margin
entry.desc: Adds a margin to a 'shape-outside'. This defines a new shape that is the smallest contour that includes all the points that are the 'shape-margin' distance outward in the perpendicular direction from a point on the underlying shape.

entry.name: shape-outside
entry.desc: This property specifies an orthogonal rotation to be applied to an image before it is laid out.

value.name: border-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the border box.

value.name: content-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the content box.

value.name: padding-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the padding box

entry.name: shape-rendering
entry.desc: The creator of SVG content might want to provide a hint to the implementation about what tradeoffs to make as it renders vector graphics elements such as path elements and basic shapes such as circles and rectangles.

entry.name: speak
entry.desc: Specifies whether text will be rendered aurally and if so, in what manner.

value.name: digits
value.desc: Speak numbers one digit at a time, for instance, 'twelve' would be spoken as 'one two', and '31' as 'three one'.

value.name: literal-punctuation
value.desc: Similar to 'normal' value, but punctuation such as semicolons, braces, and so on are to be spoken literally.

value.name: none
value.desc: Suppresses aural rendering so that the element requires no time to render.

value.name: no-punctuation
value.desc: Similar to 'normal' value but punctuation is not to be spoken nor rendered as various pauses.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Uses language-dependent pronunciation rules for rendering an element and its children. Punctuation is not spoken, but instead is rendered naturally as various pauses.

value.name: spell-out
value.desc: Spells the text one letter at a time (useful for acronyms and abbreviations). In languages where accented characters are rare, it is permitted to drop accents in favor of alternative unaccented spellings.

entry.name: speak-as
entry.desc: Determines in what manner text gets rendered aurally, based upon a basic predefined list of possible values.

value.name: digits
value.desc: Speak numbers one digit at a time, for instance, 'twelve' would be spoken as 'one two', and '31' as 'three one'.

value.name: literal-punctuation
value.desc: Punctuation such as semicolons, braces, and so on is named aloud (i.e. spoken literally) rather than rendered naturally as appropriate pauses.

value.name: no-punctuation
value.desc: Punctuation is not rendered: neither spoken nor rendered as pauses.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Uses language-dependent pronunciation rules for rendering the element's content.

value.name: spell-out
value.desc: Spells the text one letter at a time (useful for acronyms and abbreviations).

entry.name: speech-rate
entry.syntax: <number> | x-slow | slow | medium | fast | x-fast | faster | slower
entry.desc: Controls the speaking rate. The default rate for a voice depends on the language and dialect and on the personality of the voice.

value.name: fast
value.desc: Same as 300 words per minute.

value.name: faster
value.desc: Adds 40 words per minute to the current speech rate.

value.name: medium
value.desc: Same as 180-200 words per minute.

value.name: slow
value.desc: Same as 120 words per minute.

value.name: slower
value.desc: Subtracts 40 words per minute from the current speech rate.

value.name: x-fast
value.desc: Same as 500 words per minute.

value.name: x-slow
value.desc: Same as 80 words per minute.

entry.name: src
entry.desc: specifies the resource containing font data. It is required, whether the font is downloadable or locally installed. It's value is a prioritized, comma-separated list of external references or locally installed font face names.

entry.name: stop-color
entry.desc: The 'stop-color' property indicates what color to use at that gradient stop.

entry.name: stop-opacity
entry.desc: The 'stop-opacity' property defines the opacity of a given gradient stop.

entry.name: stress
entry.syntax: A value, between '0' and '100'. The meaning of values depends on the language being spoken. For example, a level of '50' for a standard, English-speaking male voice (average pitch = 122Hz), speaking with normal intonation and emphasis would have a different meaning than '50' for an Italian voice.
entry.desc: Specifies the height of 'local peaks' in the intonation contour of a voice. For example, English is a stressed language, and different parts of a sentence are assigned primary, secondary, or tertiary stress.

entry.name: stroke
entry.desc: The 'stroke' property paints along the outline of the given graphical element.

entry.name: stroke-dasharray
entry.desc: Controls the pattern of dashes and gaps used to stroke paths.

entry.name: stroke-dashoffset
entry.desc: Specifies the distance into the dash pattern to start the dash.

entry.name: stroke-linecap
entry.desc: Specifies the shape to be used at the end of open subpaths when they are stroked.

entry.name: stroke-linejoin
entry.desc: specifies the shape to be used at the corners of paths or basic shapes when they are stroked.

entry.name: stroke-miterlimit
entry.desc: When two line segments meet at a sharp angle and miter joins have been specified for 'stroke-linejoin', it is possible for the miter to extend far beyond the thickness of the line stroking the path.

entry.name: stroke-opacity
entry.desc: Specifies the opacity of the painting operation used to stroke the current object.

entry.name: stroke-width
entry.desc: This property specifies the width of the stroke on the current object.

entry.name: table-layout
entry.desc: Controls the algorithm used to lay out the table cells, rows, and columns.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Use any automatic table layout algorithm.

value.name: fixed
value.desc: Use the fixed table layout algorithm.

entry.name: tab-size
entry.desc: This property determines the width of the tab character (U+0009), in space characters (U+0020), when rendered

entry.name: text-align
entry.desc: Describes how inline contents of a block are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill the line box.

value.name: center
value.desc: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

value.name: end
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the end edge of the line box.

value.name: justify
value.desc: The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.

value.name: left
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.

value.name: match-parent
value.desc: This value behaves the same as 'inherit' except that an inherited value of 'start' or 'end' is calculated against its parent's 'direction' value.

value.name: right
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

value.name: start
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the start edge of the line box.

entry.name: text-align-last
entry.desc: Describes how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'.

value.name: center
value.desc: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

value.name: end
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the end edge of the line box.

value.name: justify
value.desc: The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.

value.name: left
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.

value.name: right
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

value.name: start
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the start edge of the line box.

entry.name: text-anchor
entry.desc: Used to align (start-, middle- or end-alignment) a string of text relative to a given point.

entry.name: text-combine-upright
entry.desc: This property specifies the combination of multiple characters into the space of a single character.

value.name: all
value.desc: Attempt to typeset horizontally all consecutive characters within the box such that they take up the space of a single character within the vertical line box.

value.name: digits
value.desc: Attempt to typeset horizontally each maximal sequence of consecutive ASCII digits (U+0030U+0039) that has as many or fewer characters than the specified integer such that it takes up the space of a single character within the vertical line box.

value.name: none
value.desc: No special processing.

entry.name: text-decoration
entry.desc: Decorations applied to font used for an element's text.

value.name: dashed
value.desc: Produces a dashed line style.

value.name: dotted
value.desc: Produces a dotted line.

value.name: double
value.desc: Produces a double line.

value.name: line-through
value.desc: Each line of text has a line through the middle.

value.name: none
value.desc: Produces no line.

value.name: overline
value.desc: Each line of text has a line above it.

value.name: solid
value.desc: Produces a solid line.

value.name: underline
value.desc: Each line of text is underlined.

value.name: wavy
value.desc: Produces a wavy line.

entry.name: text-decoration-color
entry.desc: Specifies the color of text decoration (underlines overlines, and line-throughs) set on the element with text-decoration-line.

entry.name: text-decoration-line
entry.desc: Specifies what line decorations, if any, are added to the element.

value.name: line-through
value.desc: Each line of text has a line through the middle.

value.name: none
value.desc: Neither produces nor inhibits text decoration.

value.name: overline
value.desc: Each line of text has a line above it.

value.name: underline
value.desc: Each line of text is underlined.

entry.name: text-decoration-skip
entry.desc: Specifies what parts of the element's content any text decoration affecting the element must skip over. It controls all text decoration lines drawn by the element and also any text decoration lines drawn by its ancestors.

value.name: ink
value.desc: Skip over where glyphs are drawn: interrupt the decoration line to let text show through where the text decoration would otherwise cross over a glyph. The UA may also skip a small distance to either side of the glyph outline.

value.name: none
value.desc: Skip nothing: text-decoration is drawn for all text content and for inline replaced elements.

value.name: objects
value.desc: Skip this element if it is an atomic inline (such as an image or inline-block).

value.name: spaces
value.desc: Skip white space: this includes regular spaces (U+0020) and tabs (U+0009), as well as nbsp (U+00A0), ideographic space (U+3000), all fixed width spaces (such as U+2000U+200A, U+202F and U+205F), and any adjacent letter-spacing or word-spacing.

entry.name: text-decoration-style
entry.desc: Specifies the line style for underline, line-through and overline text decoration.

value.name: dashed
value.desc: Produces a dashed line style.

value.name: dotted
value.desc: Produces a dotted line.

value.name: double
value.desc: Produces a double line.

value.name: none
value.desc: Produces no line.

value.name: solid
value.desc: Produces a solid line.

value.name: wavy
value.desc: Produces a wavy line.

entry.name: text-emphasis
entry.syntax: <color> | <string> | none | [ [ filled | open ] || [ dot | circle | double-circle | triangle | sesame ] ]
entry.desc: Shorthand for setting text-emphasis-style and text-emphasis-color in one declaration.

value.name: circle
value.desc: Draw large circles as marks. The filled circle is U+25CF '', and the open circle is U+25CB ''.

value.name: dot
value.desc: Draw small circles as marks. The filled dot is U+2022 '', and the open dot is U+25E6 ''.

value.name: double-circle
value.desc: Draw double circles as marks. The filled double-circle is U+25C9 '', and the open double-circle is U+25CE ''.

value.name: filled
value.desc: The shape is filled with solid color.

value.name: none
value.desc: No emphasis marks.

value.name: open
value.desc: The shape is hollow.

value.name: sesame
value.desc: Draw sesames as marks. The filled sesame is U+FE45 '', and the open sesame is U+FE46 ''.

value.name: triangle
value.desc: Draw triangles as marks. The filled triangle is U+25B2 '', and the open triangle is U+25B3 ''.

entry.name: text-emphasis-color
entry.desc: Describes the foreground color of the emphasis marks.
